commit_message:
Run federation jobs on Ubuntu Focal

The packaging issue that was never fixed for Bionic[1] doesn't seem to
be a problem on Focal, so let's switch back to Ubuntu.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shibboleth-sp2/+bug/1776489

Change-Id: I69b2c650d20e30e35c2388b824cb28fcef2bae77
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/726994

messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-28 02:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-28 09:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

hah, so one thing was that zun overrode it, and second that the override's name was 'ca_file' rather than 'cafile' (ah, that nasty underscore!); thanks, Hongbin"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-28 18:17:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> hah, so one thing was that zun overrode it, and second that the
 > override's name was 'ca_file' rather than 'cafile' (ah, that nasty
 > underscore!); thanks, Hongbin

Right...

Will merge this patch and release a new pip package. Then, we can test if it solves the problem."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-29 14:48:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> hah, so one thing was that zun overrode it, and second that the
 > override's name was 'ca_file' rather than 'cafile' (ah, that nasty
 > underscore!); thanks, Hongbin

@Radosław,

Can kolla pick up this commit without a release? If you guys can, I don't need to change the release model of Zun."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-30 07:41:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > hah, so one thing was that zun overrode it, and second that the
 > > override's name was 'ca_file' rather than 'cafile' (ah, that
 > nasty
 > > underscore!); thanks, Hongbin
 > 
 > @Radosław,
 > 
 > Can kolla pick up this commit without a release? If you guys can, I
 > don't need to change the release model of Zun.

Yeah, in general we can do that with a DNM patch against kolla and depends-on that one added to the kolla-ansible one. But this one seems to have merged already on master so the master images should have already picked it up."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-30 09:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

fix worked, thx: https://review.opendev.org/737192'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-30 09:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

we decided to merge the ca_files too: https://review.opendev.org/738258
it aligns with most other services

that said, are you planning to alias this to cafile? (would be less surprising that way)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-30 13:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> we decided to merge the ca_files too: https://review.opendev.org/738258
 > it aligns with most other services
 > 
 > that said, are you planning to alias this to cafile? (would be less
 > surprising that way)

Sure. Happy to do that.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-30 13:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit af2bd69f002810ab19d053b83849ff7c9b2ff979'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-07-01 19:24:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> we decided to merge the ca_files too: https://review.opendev.org/738258
 > it aligns with most other services
 > 
 > that said, are you planning to alias this to cafile? (would be less
 > surprising that way)

Actually, there are a few projects using 'ca_file' [1]. Let me ask if it is a good idea to do this renaming.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=cfg.StrOpt%5C(%27ca_file%27&i=nope&files=&repos="}]

commit_message:
Pick up cafile from keystone_auth

If ca_file is not specified in client config, use the cafile config
from keystone_auth session.

Change-Id: I99f9633ddf84d0b1809bbea87275b68412f7ed6a
Closes-Bug: #1885401

commit_message:
Include ansible whenever an update/upgrade is triggered

We need to ensure that ansible is updated/upgraded with the
rest of the packages. This needs to be done to ensure that
ansible is updated/upgraded any time an update/upgrade action
is run. ansible is not a dependency of tripleo-ansible, so
it will not come indirectly.

Resolves: rhbz#1852801
Closes-Bug: #1885637
Change-Id: I6bf815d9371e24439664e1431cf601e52ff8481c

commit_message:
[Unity]: Failed to enabled ACE for share

It is no need to enable ACE when creating CIFS share, so
remove this process.

Change-Id: Id9d248857c9a02eca486185d41b1fc22520d0919
Closes-bug: #1841035
(cherry picked from commit 47b90fa8fba882f86491ccc3959dc520271a26bd)
(cherry picked from commit 1e8e154fe0d1043cd060eed43f1fba0c2327596e)

Neutron can filter ports by subnet-id by itself, so:
- Don't send all ports in Neutron on every share-server removal
- Don't send fixed-ips fields (which are nearly half of total data)

Closes-Bug: #1879754
Change-Id: If42c9a0a662a62bbe2a02b6baee6ae13eedd8c97
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
(cherry picked from commit d5fc7d28023fb060a077e7913c38b2aa59deae4b)
(cherry picked from commit 1c25df055cfcb4a99f6010dedd9698aeab582c9f)
"}]
commit_message:
Get ports filtered by subnet id on share-server cleanup

Neutron can filter ports by subnet-id by itself, so:
- Don't send all ports in Neutron on every share-server removal
- Don't send fixed-ips fields (which are nearly half of total data)

Closes-Bug: #1879754
Change-Id: If42c9a0a662a62bbe2a02b6baee6ae13eedd8c97
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
(cherry picked from commit d5fc7d28023fb060a077e7913c38b2aa59deae4b)
(cherry picked from commit 1c25df055cfcb4a99f6010dedd9698aeab582c9f)

BaR - Export ceph authentication

need to be rebuild from scratch

Also fixed the molecule-backup_and_restore test

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-27 01:09:38.000000000', 'message': "Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
(cherry picked from commit 960993652e1ab526c1ce8cd3cd04d28f13facc86)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
(cherry picked from commit 960993652e1ab526c1ce8cd3cd04d28f13facc86)

* kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized - pip download issue
* kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized-ovn - API LB never got up, Octavia issue
* kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized-network-policy - leaderelection lost in kubernetes-scheduler, most likely etcd issue (x2)
* kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized - Neutron late to announce VIF's ACTIVE. We might want to tweak max_backoff for RetryHandler.
* kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized - looks like timing out due to Octavia being slow.

commit_message:
Periodically fetch full list of watched resources

Kuryr-Kubernetes relies on watching resources in K8s API using an HTTP
stream served by kube-apiserver. In such a distributed system this is
sometimes unstable and e.g. etcd issues can cause some events to be
omitted. To prevent controller from such situations this patch makes
sure that periodically a full list of resources is fetched and injected
as events into the handlers.

We should probably do the same for kuryr-daemon watcher, but that case
is less problematic as it'll be restarted in event of ADD requests
timing out.

Change-Id: I67874d086043071de072420df9ea5e86b3f2582e

commit_message:
[CEPH] OSH: use loopback devices for ceph osds.

- This is to make use of loopback devices for ceph osds since
support for directory backed osds going to depricate.

- Move to bluestore from filestore for ceph-osds.

Change-Id: Ia95c9ceb81f7d253dd582a2e753a6ed8fe60a04d

commit_message:
Requirements-check: use local repo like any other library

This ensures the playbook has done a local install of the repo so the
script run can assume that it is installed and can be loaded without
additional handling.

This commit also adds the change to use pip3 since the CI runs
the scripts with Python 3.

Change-Id: Iaf759b183e6821bf6690195586e7e65bf0533c82
(cherry picked from commit af94ab84790e73a86333c4c6fa778827851d720c)
(cherry picked from commit 1c270c8dd53f2aa37d93e21d353f885682cdcf08)
(cherry picked from commit 83c946d3ded550fe2cac5672915195825d1cc312)

commit_message:
CIFS extension failing because of volume in use

Unmouting of the volume from service instance sometimes fails because
Windows clients tends to check the availability of shares even if not
mounted and the volume is in use then.

Fix finds out processes via smbstatus and kill them before unmounting.

Closes-Bug: 1703581
Change-Id: I2cbf959d7cb849d3ead1655b1a0932fd428a9e9f
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2c9fbc75059ac724cd845317473b7df4a8dcdc35)
(cherry picked from commit 95d251e38b4b4526c862a428da93f568fe7a23ad)
(cherry picked from commit b07c2484b6f0d5165d867651fbc123280e7b012d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 10:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run

There were two issues with it. Lack of /usr/local/bin in PATH
for CentOS and wrong crontab path for Ubuntu/Debian.
This patch mirrors how it is handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ib54b261e12c409d66b792648807646015826e83c
Closes-Bug: #1885732
(cherry picked from commit 852c7a32c3a00d88243ef3b89ce19e6391a676b1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run

There were two issues with it. Lack of /usr/local/bin in PATH
for CentOS and wrong crontab path for Ubuntu/Debian.
This patch mirrors how it is handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ib54b261e12c409d66b792648807646015826e83c
Closes-Bug: #1885732
(cherry picked from commit 852c7a32c3a00d88243ef3b89ce19e6391a676b1)

[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-17 14:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-06-17 15:12:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Andreas for looking into the issue!

Currently gate for oslo.messaging is broken in Rocky [1] and Queens [2], because tools/test-setup.sh calls 'tox -ebindep' and that is failing with missing tox command, since 'ensure-tox' role comes later during the play.

Zuul already handles the installation of bindep, locally though we need to check manually with 'tox -e bindep'. The question is, whether anyone needs this kind of automation locally, i.e. to run tools/test-setup.sh which installs automatically all the binary dependencies.

If this is not needed, then I'm fine with the removal of test-setup.sh. As this is the simplest solution.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/cfcd1bebf5614f2db96f221b5369ab4c/log/job-output.txt#408-411
[2]https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/33111dee986d4b8fa217ec72b05d9fe6/log/job-output.txt#408-411"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-17 17:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not sure how to fix this'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

I have an idea...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-18 05:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-06-18 07:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks Andreas for the patch! Looks good to me!

However, my former question is still valid: whether the test-setup.sh is needed by someone, to install binary dependencies automatically. If that is not needed, then this patch fixes the missing tox issue. 

I don't know what are the unit test timeouts, but those should be fixed from another patch, so this patch is +1 for me."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-18 08:04:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Thanks Andreas for the patch! Looks good to me!
 > 
 > However, my former question is still valid: whether the
 > test-setup.sh is needed by someone, to install binary dependencies
 > automatically. If that is not needed, then this patch fixes the
 > missing tox issue.

test-setup.sh is written for OpenStack CI.

I'm not seeing other users - but who knows..."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:34:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

> > Thanks Andreas for the patch! Looks good to me!
 > >
 > > However, my former question is still valid: whether the
 > > test-setup.sh is needed by someone, to install binary
 > dependencies
 > > automatically. If that is not needed, then this patch fixes the
 > > missing tox issue.
 > 
 > test-setup.sh is written for OpenStack CI.
 > 
 > I'm not seeing other users - but who knows...

I agree with Andreas I don't think test-setup.sh is used by someone else."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The original idea for test_setup.sh, like for bindep, is that it was something developers could run locally to assist in configuring an environment suitable for running (primarily unit) tests, but that the exact same commands could then be leveraged in CI jobs so that we ran jobs as similarly as possible to how developers were running those tests locally.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-06-22 15:54:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Adding Ken as I think he's most likely to know whether this was ever used for setting up developer environments."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-23 17:52:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Agreed, and if we don't hear anything in the near future I'm okay with merging this. Worst case scenario it's still available in the git history.

Still need to sort out the unit test failures though."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-06-24 11:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This is the new unit test failure, which came with the 4.6.9 (and 4.6.10) release of kombu. Both patch I4768cc4485aa885d06092a56abe307487cd36710 and this patch are needed to the gate to pass.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-07-01 10:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

kombu 4.6.11 is available now. Hopefully that resolves things, in which case we can just blacklist the broken versions'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-07-01 13:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-07-01 13:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-07-01 13:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Simplify tools/test-setup.sh

test-setup.sh is called after bindep is run in CI, and tox is not setup.

Simplify the script so that it only does what's needed - install
qdrouterd for Ubuntu from qpid/testing.

Install the other packages using bindep, add test to amqp1 profile.

Add amqp1 to bindep_profiles where needed for scenario tests, previously
test-setup.sh added it everywhere.

Some tests are skipped due to changes in recent versions of kombu. These
will be unskipped when we come up with a proper fix.

Change-Id: Ic3a9e2c873619670edfbf71022d593f3cb5f70f2
Related-Bug: #1885923

commit_message:
Define periodic jobs

We sometimes create gate check changes but periodic jobs can do
most of them, particularly in stable branhces.
This commit is planed to backport to stable branches.
Note that we already have periodic-stable-jobs (for pyXX and docs jobs)
but it is nice to have npm and integration jobs in this coverage.
Once it is available in stable branches, I will configure the Grafana
dashboard to monitor healthiness in stable branches.

Change-Id: Ieb2fe4d2c4453e572c9251dc03c34d08bed62a0f

'}, {'created': '2020-05-29 11:43:55.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor buildtestpackages for downstream purpose

It includes:
* parameterize rdoinfo_repo_name
* Use zuul dict to parse zuul changes and remove zuul_deps
  ansible plugin as it is no longer needed.

  enabled only when osp_release is defined.
* Use latest rdopkg
* It also fixes the DLRN installing from source.

commit_message:
Refactor buildtestpackages for downstream purpose

It includes:
* parameterize rdoinfo_repo_name
* Use zuul dict to parse zuul changes and remove zuul_deps
  ansible plugin as it is no longer needed.
* Added dlrn config template for downstream and should be
  enabled only when osp_release is defined.
* Use latest rdopkg
* It also fixes the DLRN installing from source.
* Moves dlrn command to shell script
* Remove deprecated parts of DLRN-0.8.0
* find out zuul dict only when there is a change_url otherwise
  ignore it.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1789

Change-Id: I48bcddbc7693375396a99dc0ee79d32f6e4a4863
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: Release Zun 5.1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-29 03:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-06-29 09:14:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Zun's release model is cycle-with-rc (which means a single release at the end of the victoria cycle, with RCs just before). Here you are asking for an intermediary release.

If you truly want to be able to release multiple times during the victoria cycle, you should change the release model in this file to cycle-with-intermediary."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-06-29 14:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 10:01:03.000000000', 'message': "Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b
"}]
commit_message:
Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b

commit_message:
Use public interface for Magnum client and trustee Keystone interface

While all other clients should use internalURL, the Magnum client itself
and Keystone interface for trustee credentials should be publicly
accessible (upstream default when no config is specified) since
instances need to be able to reach them.

Closes-Bug: #1885420
Change-Id: I74359cec7147a80db24eb4aa4156c35d31a026bf

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I3555380e048f966e4dd87a4f43fcc38c01c1359d

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ibd75ec2b512dd9ef1e56560eca6f59c033891e82

commit_message:
Hide obsoletes for older distributions

we don't want to have python2/python conflicts on SLE15 based or
non-SUSE distributions.

Change-Id: I780ae07ab3a47f2833d34d71b12af21faaaebc49

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I9ad69e1d322414b962830806a9c4caedade36325
"}]
commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I9ad69e1d322414b962830806a9c4caedade36325

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I414e2127b313328756c5b15a44b661ea3982a017

commit_message:
Identity providers can be created with specifed domain

Add idp_domain_id parameter so that when creating an identity provider a
domain can be specified that the IDP resides within instead of creating
and belonging to a new auto generated domain.
This change is backwards compatible, idp_domain_id is optional.

Change-Id: If761dd4faf63cf09d436d9e0a22f7e90cec9a105
(cherry picked from commit d6d099f6c3b90ac657a8788863219580f1c4b66b)

commit_message:
Add revert to snapshot support in VxFlex OS driver

Add support for reverting to snapshot in VxFlex OS driver.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-revert-to-snapshot
Change-Id: I0ddde05a6270e06e1aee7e1e3bd5de34cc25eb3b
(cherry picked from commit 1a3ad6d8c672298cbdbadae72655fe8f3c86e4cd)

commit_message:
Add support for volume migration in VxFlex OS driver

Add support for storage-assisted volume migration in VxFlex OS driver.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-migration-support
Change-Id: Ia686afcc050b805b3479314964d341ca243dbfae
(cherry picked from commit 521a49f04c3e59a9837514853bbd12fdbdfe995f)

subject: Add OpenStack volume replication v2.1 support in VxFlex OS driver

commit_message:
Add OpenStack volume replication v2.1 support in VxFlex OS driver

Volume replication support will be added in next VxFlex OS (v3.5.0) release.
Cinder driver for VxFlex OS supports volumes/snapshots with
replication enabled according to OpenStack volume replication specification.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-replication-support
Change-Id: I3f2ec1ddf1867261253190953f7a65fff22c7404
(cherry picked from commit 4e320543cf6a115fdaa807ee9df3a8adbbd9e920)

subject: Add support for VxFlex OS 3.5 to VxFlex OS driver

commit_message:
Add support for VxFlex OS 3.5 to VxFlex OS driver

Driver code is prepared for future VxFlex OS 3.5 release.

Unit tests are fixed to work properly with updated driver.

Implements: blueprint vxflexos-replication-support
Change-Id: I693980384df22b2fa581d8715f73c69b0598dd59
(cherry picked from commit f75b2865fe2aee3f6aefea8f08ce92e1d590ac98)

It seems that with certain host configuration the ipv6 wsgi tests are

commit_message:
Extend is_ipv6_supported() to cover more error cases

It seems that with certain host configuration the ipv6 wsgi tests are
failing as the test only skipped if no ipv6 interface is available but
it does not check if the test will be able to bind to a port on that
interface. So this patch extends the skip criteria by checking if
binding is possible.

Change-Id: Iffea0586f02e8d4020cadc8c513bafe984e07a6e
Closes-Bug: #1883885

this *seems* reasonable to me, but slightly changes the semantic of a, c, o keys (which WE don't currently use our template)

We should see what OVH thinks (since they DO use these keys AND s3api?)

They may either have a solution that's better, or have some expectation that this breaks... or maybe it seems fine?

The obvious addative/backwards-compatible change is just log a new key as s3api/backend path.  But having the splitting is a pretty nice improvement, so hopefully this works for everyone?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-05-18 16:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-18 17:38:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

FWIW, I'm pretty sure OVH's solution for my problem involves ceilometermiddleware, which takes a similar-ish approach: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718085/

Still, it'd probably be good to hear Romain's thoughts."}, {'account_id': 28499, 'date': '2020-05-20 12:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This is a nice change !

When I prepared my first patch I only had billing in mind (and so ceilometermiddleware).

Actually we use `force_swift_request_proxy_log` s3api config to have log with account/container/obj field but with S3 query on multipart object that produce a lot of log entries.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-08 18:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

this works ok, but with s3_acl turned on I'm not getting anything parsed out in the object field:

I think something is wrong with the backend_path getting stuck on the acl request"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-23 17:14:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
proxy-logging: Use swift.backend_path if available

... to determine {account}, {container}, and {object} template values,
as well as statsd metric names.

UpgradeImpact:
--------------
Be aware that this will cause an increase in the proxy-logging statsd
metrics emited for s3api responses.  However, this will more accurately
reflect the state of the system.

Change-Id: Ic25f32d3c3fdf0e4f338ab8fd2f785e16fffe109

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-29 17:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Idac1769dcc3d454251ea1d2b7e65960f8f7e2dfa

commit_message:
Add test: Editing and deleting port forwarding TCP rule

After editing or deleting pf rule, the change shall be applied
in the relevant router's ip-tables.
This test checks that traffic is properly routed after making
changes to port forwarding TCP rule.

Co-Authored-By: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I07b57c901eb1110caae2b60be4584bed0cefdec4

That looks good for me. Thanks Flavio!'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-06-23 09:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-06-23 09:37:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I wonder what's the benefit of having this test. Is it adding some scenario that's not already covered?

Initially IIUC it was designed to have a SG that's not the default one and *without* egress rules to prove that DHCP and Metadata would still work.
However, looks like Metadata won't work because Neutron doesn't add rules to handle metadata (it does for DHCP though) so I wonder if this test has value as it is right now."}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-23 14:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I wonder what's the benefit of having this test. Is it adding some
 > scenario that's not already covered?
 > 
 > Initially IIUC it was designed to have a SG that's not the default
 > one and *without* egress rules to prove that DHCP and Metadata
 > would still work.
 > However, looks like Metadata won't work because Neutron doesn't add
 > rules to handle metadata (it does for DHCP though) so I wonder if
 > this test has value as it is right now.

Valid point, Daniel! The ingress SG isolation related tests above also
specify protocol and ports. And maybe that is enough coverage?

If you look at revision 2 of this change, you can see that it removed
all egress rules, but that will only work if we added a rule to allow
metadata. ml2/ovs will only add DHCP related egress rule(s), which is
"incomplete", depending on how we look at it.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736076/2..3

Without https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733033 ml2/ovn will not work
at all, since the subnet pgs would be what adds the DHCP related rules.

I can revert a piece of revision 2 and explicitly add metadata+dhcp
egress rules. Would that make this test any more relevant? I can also just
abandon this gerrit. No harm feelings. ;)

All in all, one could argue that users who remove the default egress
rules may be interested in adding the dhcp+metadata+whatever rules
themselves and have more control. In a picture, this would look like this:
https://imgflip.com/i/45omyu   ;^)'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-23 21:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-06-23 21:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-06-26 10:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-06-26 10:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Generally the test looks good, I'm still unsure about what it's bringing to the table compared to what's already in place.
I'd let other reviewers to chime in."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-06-30 12:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2020-06-30 22:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-07-01 08:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Add test for checking intra security group isolation

Default security group allows ingress packets of the same
security group (aka intra-sg). However, this may not be
what users want and these rules can be removed at any time.
This new test ensures that even in such cases, servers are
able to receive traffic like metadata and DHCP.

Related-Bug: #1881316
Change-Id: Iceb2abf908fa3c7bb59dec2c0400c8b2ba6fc1a8
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pep8: cap hacking to an appropriate old release

Newer versions brings in newer flake8 releases which enable new rule
and make the verification fail on pre-ussuri branches.

This change affects train and older releases.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/737838

Change-Id: Ic25fa41fe71805a8ef52cd41947274e5999f1339
(cherry picked from commit 45d9097e4bbdcfa2a43b6c366dc0cf8503b96edf)

commit_message:
Fix not exist deploy image within irmc-virtual-media booting

With partition image, this change will fetch the deploy image
before boot image creating.

Change-Id: I1ffd5c3af0f499a1bef663b01b636d3ecbb9a53d
Story: #2003338
Task: #24376
(cherry picked from commit 546a115239e506769ff5b8983bee08c148679053)

commit_message:
Fix Ceph upgrade issue by porting charm to common framework

Move helpers as-is from reactive handler module to charm class.

Set default of ``source`` configuration option to 'distro' to be
in line with other reactive charms and the expectations of the
``openstack.utils.get_source_and_pgp_key`` function.

Unpin flake8.

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/313
Depends-On: I6fbde855ba8f83ef5e265bd5b5dfb0d01eae830b
Change-Id: I2d8e8b244db935673406d2cce9ef34e7252cb50b
Closes-Bug: #1879072

There is a bug in OVN functional tests, where it looks for datapath binding
of just created network.
In rare conditions datapath binding entry could not be in place in time,
because it is a ovn-northd responsibility to create it and we don't lock
this process in neutron api.

Change-Id: Ice115623491ad5b50397a0338f0a7780dc05d24c
Closes-Bug: #1884986
"}, {'created': '2020-06-30 09:56:19.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Wait for WaitForDataPathBindingCreateEvent event in functional tests

There is a bug in OVN functional tests, where it looks for datapath binding

commit_message:
[OVN] Wait for WaitForDataPathBindingCreateEvent event in functional tests

There is a bug in OVN functional tests, where it looks for datapath binding
of just created network.
In rare conditions datapath binding entry could not be in place in time,
because it is a ovn-northd responsibility to create it and we don't lock
this process in neutron api.

Change-Id: Ice115623491ad5b50397a0338f0a7780dc05d24c
Closes-Bug: #1884986

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Idb45c6b09980c6850b1acf05a03c9be59fb254bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-30 22:17:49.000000000', 'message': 'Enable MySQL TLS

Enable passing the certificate authority on the relation in order to
enable TLS communication to the MySQL DB.

In order to enable MySQL to use TLS for client connections all that is
required is the CA certificate. A certificate and key may be used for
client certificate authentication. However, since almost all deployments
will not use certificate authentication, focusing on the CA as SSL data
complete makes sense.

Change-Id: I1a55e2c342a9f62a6b02da7334e309536bd4eda2
'}]
commit_message:
Enable MySQL TLS

Enable passing the certificate authority on the relation in order to
enable TLS communication to the MySQL DB.

In order to enable MySQL to use TLS for client connections all that is
required is the CA certificate. A certificate and key may be used for
client certificate authentication. However, since almost all deployments
will not use certificate authentication, focusing on the CA as SSL data
complete makes sense.

Change-Id: I1a55e2c342a9f62a6b02da7334e309536bd4eda2

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Iff96a7a4c8f2a0f625a47ac44158d904fa132157

commit_message:
Enable MySQL TLS

Enable passing the certificate authority on the relation in order to
enable TLS communication to the MySQL DB.

In order to enable MySQL to use TLS for client connections all that
is required is the CA certificate. A certificate and key may be used
for client certificate authentication. However, since almost all
deployments will not use certificate authentication, focusing on the CA as SSL
data complete makes sense.

Change-Id: I785afe7f64cb57caa857178d529e3cabdcf63517

commit_message:
Update os-brick library to 2.8.6

The previous version contained a regression that affected operation
when running under Python 2.7 while using the Dell EMC VxFlex OS
(ScaleIO) storage backend.

Change-Id: I018007bd865b69631c21af83efdf6aba981161f1

recheck - depends-on patch updated'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-07-01 13:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I don't think the solution here is to blacklist things. Rather, we should resolve the change in behavior. It's clearly intended as a feature of kombu - not a bug that they're going to fix."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-07-01 13:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I don't think the solution here is to blacklist things. Rather, we
 > should resolve the change in behavior. It's clearly intended as a
 > feature of kombu - not a bug that they're going to fix.

Yes, I got the same feedback from Matthew in the patch in requirements repository (see depends-on).
Actually I investigated the stable job failures when I came across this issue, and found that kombu brought in a change that is the cause of the failures. But I don't really have knowledge about oslo.messaging and have some other things as well that I was/am working on, so if anyone has any idea how to fix this in a correct way, then it is welcomed. :)"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-07-01 14:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736248/5'}]

Add new restriction for kombu

Unit test gets timed out with kombu newer than 4.6.8.
This patch is identified as the cause of the timeouts:

https://github.com/celery/kombu/pull/1193/commits/398aa5b8cd1fe1fc189ab35a2cb0bececf51bf37

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/737307

commit_message:
Constrain kombu in global requirements

oslo.messaging unit tests started to time out when kombu version 4.6.9
was released, so let's exclude kombu 4.6.9 and newer versions until the
issue is fixed.

The patch that causing the unit tests to fail is:

https://github.com/celery/kombu/pull/1193/commits/398aa5b8cd1fe1fc189ab35a2cb0bececf51bf37

NOTE(elod.illes): amqp is constrained due to kombu 4.6.8 constrain
amqp to less than 2.6.0

Change-Id: I79350c8f66c0229768af64631542b5c1b5d48af9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-26 15:41:59.000000000', 'message': "Use venv instead of virtualenv in generate script

The gate nodes no longer have the virtualenv package globally installed
and available, resulting in our nightly job failing with the error:

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'virtualenv'

To get around this, this patch updates our generate.py code to use the
venv module that is part of the standard lib in Python 3.3 and later.

Change-Id: I128ce15a1b6ce885dacae4ecd160f5892215683b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use venv instead of virtualenv in generate script

The gate nodes no longer have the virtualenv package globally installed
and available, resulting in our nightly job failing with the error:

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'virtualenv'

To get around this, this patch updates our generate.py code to use the
venv module that is part of the standard lib in Python 3.3 and later.

Change-Id: I128ce15a1b6ce885dacae4ecd160f5892215683b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add validation cli script

In order to be able to run validation without any
TripleO package installed and as a first step before
an Undercloud deployment, this review add a simple
CLI implementation which expose basic commands in order
to run, list and show validation on a system.

The user will only have to install either:
tripleo-validations rpm package or
pip install validations-common and validations-libs.

Change-Id: I7131ba18b625da282a529473cd804dbdae5a424e

commit_message:
Remove playbook param from run_validation

Removing playbook parameters from run_validation function
since its overlap validation_name functionality and make it
confusing.

Change-Id: Ifff9bdb327b38db07df6cac328cbd387f2bc46f1

commit_message:
Enhance VNF LCM API based on ETSI NFV-SOL specification

This spec aim to implement remaining VNF LCM API features
that are not implemented in Ussuri release.

* Support remaining API message-body attributes
* Support "vnfPkgId" to related LCM APIs
* Enable URI query parameters based on NFV-SOL v2.4.1

Blueprint: support-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: Icc79264fa7bfd207a51f83319cfbaa5b1bb87a21

[{'created': '2020-06-28 16:35:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add Elasticsearch Curator Docker image

Kolla provides log aggregation, but no solution to set retention periods
for aggregated logs. It therefore accumulates log data indefinitely unless
a user manually intervenes. This change adds Elasticsearch Curator which
provides a mechanism for automating such retention periods [1].

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/current/about.html

The container contains cron to support running Curator periodically.

Change-Id: Ief2c554a64ef6cc971635d7e2a718f63c310fbf6
(cherry picked from commit 37de8920aa7394089731c0fae75034c2c3d137ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Elasticsearch Curator Docker image

Kolla provides log aggregation, but no solution to set retention periods
for aggregated logs. It therefore accumulates log data indefinitely unless
a user manually intervenes. This change adds Elasticsearch Curator which
provides a mechanism for automating such retention periods [1].

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/current/about.html

The container contains cron to support running Curator periodically.

Change-Id: Ief2c554a64ef6cc971635d7e2a718f63c310fbf6
(cherry picked from commit 37de8920aa7394089731c0fae75034c2c3d137ca)

commit_message:
Refactor ceph-ansible upgrade

ceph-ansible and python-tripleoclient have different "minimum" required
version of ansible in specification. This patch upgrades ceph-ansible as
prerequisite so all dependencies will be met. In fast-forward script
checks if ceph-ansible is installed.If yes, it will upgrade it to latest
versions in repositories.

Change-Id: I9769eedeccf9b6c6d6221ade457fb5b4ba8a736b
Related-Bug: #1885637

Change-Id: Ia45b7a40db15fd9143f1cff4f66b19dc1416d981
Related-Bug: 1885637

commit_message:
Upgrade ceph-ansible as prerequisite

ceph-ansible and python-tripleoclient have different "minimum" required
version of ansible in specification. This patch upgrades ceph-ansible as
prerequisite so all dependencies will be met.

Change-Id: I9769eedeccf9b6c6d6221ade457fb5b4ba8a736b
Related-Bug: #1885637

Update/Upgrade ansible prior Upgrade/Update/FFWD

[{'created': '2020-06-29 22:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for bugfix/3.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as bugfix/3.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic65becddcfc492534525e605848f708e8a2eb263
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for bugfix/3.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as bugfix/3.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic65becddcfc492534525e605848f708e8a2eb263

commit_message:
Add Logstash 6 for Monasca on Centos 8

On Centos 8 we have Elasticsearch and Kibana 6, but Logstash (used by
Monasca) is stuck on 2 which is not compatible. See the product
compatibility matrix [1]. This adds Logstash 6, so that Monasca
can use the full ELK 6 stack on Centos 8.

Note that Monasca doesn't officially support ELK 6, but it does work.

[1] https://www.elastic.co/support/matrix#matrix_compatibility

Partial-Bug: #1884090
Change-Id: Id6f79e301cc109a029913f5628bab1848c138e7f

[{'created': '2020-06-08 16:58:23.000000000', 'message': 'Reload files in policy_dirs on primary file change

It was determined that rules from policy files located in the directory
specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from
policy_dirs are reapplied if there is a change to the primary policy
file.

commit_message:
Reload files in policy_dirs on primary file change

It was determined that rules from policy files located in the directory
specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from
policy_dirs are reapplied if there is a change to the primary policy
file.

Change-Id: I8a6f8e971d881365c41ea409966723319d5b239a
Closes-Bug: #1880959
Related-Bug: #1880847
(cherry picked from commit 75677a31108243e0adddc89f1fbf669053f9573b)
(cherry picked from commit 5904564bf13bbac7d66e00ec6312487c507f09c4)

commit_message:
Make test-setup.sh compatible with mysql8

Starting from mysql version 8 it's not possible to create a user
implictly when using GRANT.

This patch makes the behavior compatible with that.

Change-Id: I10dacfe8fa425a1b1dfd4b8862a7460caa5c579f
Co-written-by: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Update ReSizeSteam.next() to ReSizeSteam__next__()
messages: [{'account_id': 21069, 'date': '2020-07-01 02:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2020-07-01 06:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nthanks'}, {'account_id': 21069, 'date': '2020-07-01 10:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 02:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update ReSizeSteam.next() to ReSizeSteam__next__()

1. The bug.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Traceback (most recent call last):

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/tests/unit/openstack/test_backup.py", line 37, in test_backup_cinder_by_glance
    self.bakup_os.backup_cinder_by_glance(35)

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/openstack/backup.py", line 79, in backup_cinder_by_glance
    self.storage.add_stream(stream, package, headers=headers)

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/storage/swift.py", line 163, in add_stream
    for el in stream:

    TypeError: iter() returned non-iterator of type 'ReSizeStream'
2. Fix
In python3.x , a iterator object should be difined two funs " __iter__()" and "__next__()".

Update ReSizeSteam.next() to ReSizeSteam.__next__().

Change-Id: I940841b94789d024d3b9447f96158963fe3e16ee
'}]
commit_message:
Update ReSizeSteam.next() to ReSizeSteam__next__()

1. The bug.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Traceback (most recent call last):

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/tests/unit/openstack/test_backup.py", line 37, in test_backup_cinder_by_glance
    self.bakup_os.backup_cinder_by_glance(35)

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/openstack/backup.py", line 79, in backup_cinder_by_glance
    self.storage.add_stream(stream, package, headers=headers)

      File "/opt/stack/freezer/freezer/storage/swift.py", line 163, in add_stream
    for el in stream:

    TypeError: iter() returned non-iterator of type 'ReSizeStream'
2. Fix
In python3.x , a iterator object should be difined two funs " __iter__()" and "__next__()".

Update ReSizeSteam.next() to ReSizeSteam.__next__().

Change-Id: I940841b94789d024d3b9447f96158963fe3e16ee

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints versions

This updates lower constraints to versions that will work with py38 so
that when we move to running on focal nodes, which has py38 as its
default py3 runtime, the lower-constraints job will continue to pass.

It also cleans out some secondary requirements that are no longer needed
due to our direct dependencies being updated.

Linters are removed that are kept in the global requirements blacklist
as those are not version tracked and are not relevant for our
lower-constraints unit test runs.

Change-Id: I60af0a8c5241190e5c889ff8f9aba3a4b3acc04c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove dragonflow

Dragonflow was removed from governance in 2018 and is now being retired.
This cleans up references to dragonflow jobs and configuration.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015600.html

This backport drops sample config file and docs changes and only removes
the zuul configuration since conceivable the project could still be used
with older branches.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738389/
Change-Id: Ie990da4e68e82d998768fa0c047cca4cccd59915
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit cded615f86bbf44597df62617a002329dfad74d3)

subject: Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run
messages:
[{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-30 14:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-06-30 14:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+2 Code-Review+2

Thanks Radek! It's not entirely clear to me when this broke on Centos  - we were running it out-of-tree for some time."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-30 14:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-30 15:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks Radek! It's not entirely clear to me when this broke on
 > Centos  - we were running it out-of-tree for some time.

You are welcome! I don't know either, I was a bit puzzled as it worked when run manually, yet cron seemed to ignore it (and we don't collect logs from cron as its syslog really goes to /dev/null). Turned out to be lacking PATH (both CentOS versions), and Ubuntu/Debian obviously do things differently."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-06-30 15:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-01 09:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-01 10:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit 3114af254a88df6b7f480aa8e81696e0417174d7'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-30 14:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run

There were two issues with it. Lack of /usr/local/bin in PATH
for CentOS and wrong crontab path for Ubuntu/Debian.
This patch mirrors how it is handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ib54b261e12c409d66b792648807646015826e83c
Closes-Bug: #1885732
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run

There were two issues with it. Lack of /usr/local/bin in PATH
for CentOS and wrong crontab path for Ubuntu/Debian.
This patch mirrors how it is handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ib54b261e12c409d66b792648807646015826e83c
Closes-Bug: #1885732

subject: Release python-magnumclient 3.0.1
messages:
[{'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-06-29 11:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-06-29 13:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-29 17:23:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This adds new functionality that would typically be against stable policy for what is allowed to be backported. That said, this project does not assert that it follows stable policy, and it doesn't break anything, so that should be OK.

It should also be a minor version bump to indicate new functionality is being added because of that, but we've already released 3.1.0 as part of victoria, so I guess we're stuck."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:30:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have two questions here:

1. I'm the PTL of Magnum, and I haven't +1 for this patch, why is it showing PTL Approved?

2. We have already released 3.1.0, what's the purpose to release this 3.0.1? Can't 3.1.1 work?"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:39:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I have two questions here:
 > 
 > 1. I'm the PTL of Magnum, and I haven't +1 for this patch, why is
 > it showing PTL Approved?
 > 
 > 2. We have already released 3.1.0, what's the purpose to release
 > this 3.0.1? Can't 3.1.1 work?

For 1, Spyros is currently listed as a release liaison for the project. Please put up a review to remove or change that liaison list if you no longer want that to be the case.

Regard 2, this is a stable release off of stable/ussuri, so I am guess that is the reason for not just going with the existing 3.1.0 and/or wanting to do a 3.1.1 release."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Link to that release liaison data:

https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/data/release_liaisons.yaml#L56'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:45:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean, thanks for the quick response. For #1, that makes perfect sense for me. For #2, I prefer to wait for Spyros's confirmation if this version is particular for stable/ussuri.

Sorry for the interruption."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"if this version is particular for stable/ussuri." - this is releasing off a stable/ussuri commit, so I don't think it was a mistake that it was proposed from ussuri. But let's wait and make sure everyone is on the same page before we do anything.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-06-29 21:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Sean.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-06-30 07:34:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It should also be a minor version bump to indicate new
 > functionality is being added because of that, but we've already
 > released 3.1.0 as part of victoria, so I guess we're stuck.

Thanks Sean, this is exactly the reason for selecting 3.0.1, we are stuck."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-06-30 07:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

@Spyros, thanks for the clarification. It's good to go."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-30 13:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-07-01 09:38:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Yep we are stuck with bugfixes only for stable/ussuri [1] even with new feature [2]... let's release these changes, though.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/deliverables/victoria/python-magnumclient.yaml#L10
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/6d1a386e401095c169b069ac7d30930038159de3"}]

commit_message:
Add new tests to molecule/infrared

This patch contains new tests which check that:
    - *.tar files with logs are properly deleted
    - artcl_collect_dir works correctly
    - artcl_rsync_collect_list=false generates
      list of files to be collected by rsync using find

Change-Id: I9dd7a40e431b7f107a145934859a072fcef6c41f

commit_message:
Set [magnum_client]endpoint_type to publicURL

Software deployments for k8s cluster creation will try to curl
the magnum API on the configured endpoint from inside an instance.
Reaching the internal API endpoint should not be possible from
an instance.

Change-Id: Ibf6190497639e5a515e1bc4b9ad47c0524f7ca14
Closes-Bug: #1885877

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 18:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2020-06-25 18:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

(2 comments)

We typically don't do heavy-weight ops in the update-status hook.

Related to my concerns around boto3 imports, is there any reason other than storage_backend_connection() that the charm runtime needs to import boto3?

I would prefer to keep boto3's usage limited to the functional tests and only use gnocchi's native s3 functionality at charm runtime."}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 19:38:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > We typically don't do heavy-weight ops in the update-status hook.
 > 
 > Related to my concerns around boto3 imports, is there any reason
 > other than storage_backend_connection() that the charm runtime
 > needs to import boto3?
 > 
 > I would prefer to keep boto3's usage limited to the functional
 > tests and only use gnocchi's native s3 functionality at charm
 > runtime.

Yes, gnocchi itself needs it whenever it does its connection to the backend. This is not explicit in the charm, but it is triggered in the gnocchi-upgrade script. I tested previously without installing boto3 explicitly, and it turns out that boto3 is not installed by default in gnocchi, even if it is a native functionality. 

Regarding the custom_assess_status_check(), yes it can seem costly. But I added this following a conversation with @jamespages, where we decided that it is better to verify that the configuration is correct with a check to the s3 backend, rather then letting the charm install go into error. Otherwise, it fails on a hook that has nothing obvious to do with the actual gnocchi-upgrade action, and it would be pretty hard for a user to find that their credentials/network are actually the reason of the failure."}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 19:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 19:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-06-26 09:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)

General question as well - do we need to deal with the situation where the storage-backend option is not set to a valid value? I think we should and that the charm should block in this scenario.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-06-26 09:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-06-26 09:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Please see my additional comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-29 18:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-30 00:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-30 00:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(9 comments)

Thank you for the review Ryan, Alex and James. I changed the s3 check to go into the handlers, associated to the different errors states that states_to_check can then flag in the message status. I also added ssl in all my test bundles and tested everything locally. Please review again as there are many changes. I will launch a whole recheck and hopefully we will be able to merge this patch this week!'}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2020-06-30 00:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Enable S3 storage backend for Gnocchi

This feature enables the use of a S3 storage backend for Gnocchi.

Charm specs PR: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738631/
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/334

Change-Id: I959ed69e08b178cddf72535f22499a66b24f9567

commit_message:
Fix confusing logging when running asynchronous commands

We log them as completed when they start executing.

Also fix a problem in remove_large_keys that prevented items
with defaultdict from being logged.

Change-Id: I34a06cc85f55c693416f8c4c9877d55d6affafc9
(cherry picked from commit 0eee26ea66c752715d863dfa03f8490f6ff04100)

commit_message:
Omit configdrive and system_logs from logging

Since they are large and base64-encoded, they bloat ramdisk logs.

Conflicts:
	ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_utils.py
	ironic_python_agent/utils.py

The backport has been updated for Python 2 support.

Change-Id: I2e995ef356075be2a7f5b0a1906d02f90fe98a06
(cherry picked from commit d40132ad7105ec1b039d025587a82510ea9698f4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-30 16:45:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes minor issues in the read() retries patch

Follow-up to commit c5b97eb781cf9851f9abe87a1500b4da55b8bde8.

Two things slipped through the cracks:
* ImageDownloadError was instantiated incorrectly, resulting in a wrong
  error message. This was uncovered by using assertRaisesRegext in tests.
* We allowed calling write(None). This was uncovered by avoiding sleep(4)
  in tests and enabling more failed calls before timeout.

Change-Id: If5e798c5461ea3e474a153574b0db2da96f2dfa8
(cherry picked from commit 00ad03b709275e185ccb5b8e80cb7db4b9071d56)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes minor issues in the read() retries patch

Follow-up to commit c5b97eb781cf9851f9abe87a1500b4da55b8bde8.

Two things slipped through the cracks:
* ImageDownloadError was instantiated incorrectly, resulting in a wrong
  error message. This was uncovered by using assertRaisesRegext in tests.
* We allowed calling write(None). This was uncovered by avoiding sleep(4)
  in tests and enabling more failed calls before timeout.

Change-Id: If5e798c5461ea3e474a153574b0db2da96f2dfa8
(cherry picked from commit 00ad03b709275e185ccb5b8e80cb7db4b9071d56)

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ie3e3fabe088f3df638708d062b63c0f0580d1d64

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I05854d8abcf4fd7f736ae56bea38f8f4f42e12fe

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I90fa5ab8085a07c3f19b32cfdbbeb6bfe3953087

In some cases it may be useful to log new vlan tag which is found

So this patch adds such value to the log message.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I231e624f460510decc6d2237040c8bef207e2e8e

commit_message:
Improve log message when port losts its vlan tag

In some cases it may be useful to log new vlan tag which is found
on the port when it losts old vlan tag which should is expected to
be there.
So this patch adds such value to the log message.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I231e624f460510decc6d2237040c8bef207e2e8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 14:14:26.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Check authorization before import for image

Right now we only check to see if the user can see the image before
we kick off an import operation. However, that will never work unless
the user is the *owner* of the image (or an admin) which means we
return a 202 to the API caller and then the task fails immediately.

This change makes us check that authorization up front and return an
appropriate code to the user so they know it failed, and avoid starting
a task destined for failure.

NOTE: This needs tests, I'm just pushing it up to see if it signals nova

Change-Id: I385f222c5e3b46978b40bdefdc28fcb20d9c67d3
Closes-Bug: #1884587
"}, {'created': '2020-06-24 14:37:21.000000000', 'message': 'Check authorization before import for image

Right now we only check to see if the user can see the image before
we kick off an import operation. However, that will never work unless
the user is the *owner* of the image (or an admin) which means we
return a 202 to the API caller and then the task fails immediately.

This change makes us check that authorization up front and return an
appropriate error to the user so they know it failed, and avoid
starting a task destined for failure.

Note that there was already a check for a Forbidden result when calling
the import API. However, that used a context.owner=None which could never
happen in reality. A more suitable check would have been to use a context
with a different real owner, but it turns out that the task creation
would have succeeded in that case as well. This test is changed to use
an alternate owner and ensure that we get the forbidden result from the
new check immediately.

Change-Id: I385f222c5e3b46978b40bdefdc28fcb20d9c67d3
Closes-Bug: #1884587

commit_message:
Check authorization before import for image

Right now we only check to see if the user can see the image before
we kick off an import operation. However, that will never work unless
the user is the *owner* of the image (or an admin) which means we
return a 202 to the API caller and then the task fails immediately.

This change makes us check that authorization up front and return an
appropriate error to the user so they know it failed, and avoid
starting a task destined for failure.

Note that there was already a check for a Forbidden result when calling
the import API. However, that used a context.owner=None which could never
happen in reality. A more suitable check would have been to use a context
with a different real owner, but it turns out that the task creation
would have succeeded in that case as well. This test is changed to use
an alternate owner and ensure that we get the forbidden result from the
new check immediately.

Change-Id: I385f222c5e3b46978b40bdefdc28fcb20d9c67d3
Closes-Bug: #1884587

[{'created': '2020-06-26 17:35:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata address usage

There are places where we need to use a metadata address
in different forms:

  169.254.169.254
    - when binding to an address, used with a port

  169.254.169.254/32
    - when configuring an address on an interface
    - when adding a route

  169.254.169.254/16
    - when checking if a metadata subnet is present

We wer not always using them correctly in either the
DHCP or OVN code, try and correct the usage. This will
make it easier to update the code when adding support
for metadata over IPv6.

Change-Id: I1780aa99204cc24e668d9798f4a5111eae83ecdb

commit_message:
Fix metadata address usage

There are places where we need to use a metadata address
in different forms:

  169.254.169.254
    - when binding to an address, used with a port

  169.254.169.254/32
    - when configuring an address on an interface
    - when adding a route

  169.254.0.0/16
    - when checking if a metadata subnet is present

We were not always using them correctly in either the
DHCP or OVN code, try and correct the usage. This will
make it easier to update the code when adding support
for metadata over IPv6.

Change-Id: I1780aa99204cc24e668d9798f4a5111eae83ecdb

commit_message:
Make mariadb chart compatible with mariadb 10.4.13

since mariadb 10.4.13 definer of view mysql.user is not root
but mariadb.sys user. So when we remove it we break mysql_upgrade,
it fails to fix views. It is safe not to remove it because
the account by default is locked and cannot login.

Change-Id: I5183d7cbb09e18d0e87e0aef8c59bb71ec2f1cb5
Related-Bug: https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-22542

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ie0e43904d375e542ca00cd43b3c84c7afb31ee85

commit_message:
Check for nova exception.Conflict rather than task_state

When detaching and attaching volumes nova would raise an
exception.Conflict, if attach and detach can't happen. Let's
use that to retry rather than using task_state.

Change-Id: I50904e4254568cd807b9ff18eef482cadb626ce5
Task: 40169

commit_message:
Fix horizon-nodejs jobs

Tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
The file package.json needs tox, install it to fix the job.

Install it via a pre-run playbook so that this is run in addition to all
of the playbooks of the parent.

Note for the reviewer in stable/stein we run nodejs-4 jobs as runtime.
I have cherry-pick this change from master which run nodejs-10 job
but simliar changes fixes the nodejs-4 jobs So I have added pre-run
playbook for nodejs-4 job as well.

Change-Id: Icf82fa96f7d90453f78cf564c847682a286ed575
(cherry picked from commit 7cd0debebe1a300a96f8d0f21626793be0a0bc41)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-29 17:57:56.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)

[{'created': '2020-06-25 16:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: investigating bug 1741425

Fix NFS/CIFS share creation failure issue

When the image count is over 25, there might not get
manila-service-image, because current manila shares
creation is using novaclient to get image info, but
novaclient can only get 25 images due to pagination
of glance server, So this change is to switch to use
glanceclient instead of novaclient to get image info,
because glanceclient can iter all image info, while
novaclient is rarely maintained with stuff of image
API.

commit_message:
Fix NFS/CIFS share creation failure issue

When the image count is over 25, there might not get
manila-service-image, because current manila shares
creation is using novaclient to get image info, but
novaclient can only get 25 images due to pagination
of glance server, So this change is to switch to use
glanceclient instead of novaclient to get image info,
because glanceclient can iter all image info, while
novaclient is rarely maintained with stuff of image
API.

Change-Id: Id1715d0b9cb3a4aeedeb23d9b1d9924a78d18dc6
Closes-Bug: #1741425

[{'created': '2020-06-30 09:57:45.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid empty "vsctl" transactions

The OVS DB "vsctl" implementation does not allow empty transactions.
In [1], if qos and queue are None, this transaction won't have any
operation. In "vsctl" implementation this will raise the following
exception:
  Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: ; Stderr: ovs-vsctl: missing command
    name (use --help for help)

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738171/1/neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py@914

Change-Id: Iece42986b32e774018affbbbe83923ce73590d77
Closes-Bug: #1885695
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid empty "vsctl" transactions

The OVS DB "vsctl" implementation does not allow empty transactions.
In [1], if qos and queue are None, this transaction won't have any
operation. In "vsctl" implementation this will raise the following
exception:
  Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: ; Stderr: ovs-vsctl: missing command
    name (use --help for help)

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738171/1/neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py@914

Change-Id: Iece42986b32e774018affbbbe83923ce73590d77
Closes-Bug: #1885695

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-08 14:58:34.000000000', 'message': 'objects: Add NovaComparableObject mixin

We don't want to implement an '__eq__' method for NovaObject because the
meaning of equality is very subjective. For example, if we take an
object and pass it as an argument to a remote method, the object we
receive at the end will be subtly different. Similarly, if we're using a
mixin like NovaPersistentObject, which adds a number of timestamp
fields, we may or may not care about these fields.

Despite all of this, there is a clear pattern of folks wanting to do
high-level comparisons of objects, both in test code and "real" code.
This has resulted in some level of duplication, along with buggy
comparison implementations. Resolve this by providing a new mixin,
NovaComparableObject, which allows us to provide very basic comparison
of the objects. We include a big warning about the high-level nature of
this mixin and suggest people implement their own version, should needs
call for such as thing. This should keep most people (+ me) happy.

Change-Id: Ie8d3d173524e15c6457569a2750d73d71f3891c1
'}, {'created': '2017-06-08 15:10:23.000000000', 'message': 'objects: Add NovaComparableObject mixin

We don't want to implement an '__eq__' method for NovaObject because the
meaning of equality is very subjective. For example, if we take an
object and pass it as an argument to a remote method, the object we
receive at the end will be subtly different. Similarly, if we're using a
mixin like NovaPersistentObject, which adds a number of timestamp
fields, we may or may not care about these fields.

Despite all of this, there is a clear pattern of folks wanting to do
high-level comparisons of objects, both in test code and "real" code.
This has resulted in some level of duplication, along with buggy
comparison implementations. Resolve this by providing a new mixin,
NovaComparableObject, which allows us to provide very basic comparison
of the objects. We include a big warning about the high-level nature of
this mixin and suggest people implement their own version, should needs
call for such as thing. This should keep most people (+ me) happy.

Change-Id: Ie8d3d173524e15c6457569a2750d73d71f3891c1
'}, {'created': '2017-06-09 15:37:17.000000000', 'message': "objects: Remove custom comparison methods

There's simply no reason to reinvent the wheel multiple times. Use the
standard comparison operation.

commit_message:
objects: Remove custom comparison methods

There's simply no reason to reinvent the wheel multiple times. Use the
standard comparison operation.

Change-Id: Ie8d3d173524e15c6457569a2750d73d71f3891c1

subject: Fix up adding availability zone (AZ) to a host on creation

commit_message:
Fix up adding availability zone (AZ) to a host on creation

1. Nova AZ returns hosts as service hosts as opposed to hypervisor
   hostnames
2. Handle case where a Nova AZ has no hosts

Change-Id: If6f6cf21170e95c58dd8a0a1b41b9b5f4797a627
Closes-Bug: #1880646

(5 comments)

Hmmm, this change made me look up this whole test credential business with tempest. It feels like we didn't account for tempest's ability to provide us with different tenants for the same test class! Which is why we keep spawning new isolated credentials to do stuff. However, if we relied on the tenants tempest creates with test case annotations, we don't need to create any more isolated creds!
