commit_message:
Make sure failed containers get stopped by systemd

When the main PID (i.e., common) of a container is killed because of
some reasons, systemd won't execute ExecStop command.
Current podman doesn't detect this failure ang recognize that container
is still running and this causes failure when systemd tries to restart
the container.

This patch introduces ExecStopPost configuration into systemd unit
files so that stop operation is executed even when a container fails
because of killed main process. The stale container should be cleaned
up by ExecStopPost task before systemd tries to restart it.

Note that the similar change has been introcuded to "podman generate
systemd" command already[1].
[1] https://github.com/containers/libpod/commit/e5c3432944245a740ed443803c654dcc9c3757f0

Change-Id: Idb8be98f83f95ae536762f79809aa375f04e56ab

commit_message:
DRAC: Drives conversion from JBOD to RAID

Added physical drives conversion from JBOD to RAID
mode before RAID create_configuration cleaning step called
in iDRAC driver.

Change-Id: Ie6d1a9314d1543b73889f6d419541e75b7e06c89
Story: #2006479
Task: #36422

subject: DRAC: Drives conversion from raid to jbod

Should this be Workflow-1 until it can be rebased to that forthcoming change?"}, {'account_id': 29405, 'date': '2019-07-25 07:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow-1

commit_message:
DRAC: Drives conversion from raid to jbod

Added physical drives conversion from RAID to JBOD
mode after RAID delete_configuration cleaning step called
in iDRAC driver.

Change-Id: I59bad3d8969cc8374d1436b91b32a21b38ca8d69
Story: 2006234
Task: 35835

commit_message:
Add more guidlines about how to contribute on oslo

These changes are extracted from oslo's projects contribution guide
`CONTRIBUTING.rst`, it could be more relevant to move them here and in a
second time to remove similar sentences on oslo.*.

Centralize it here will avoid to us to send patch over ~40 projects if
updated are needed on this part in the future.

Change-Id: Ia5cd75427ab72f6fc05308c726b7523bad69c1e6

commit_message:
Add port-uuid parameter to node vif attach

vif_attach has the capability to attach to a specific baremetal port.
This change provides an explicit (and optional) parameter for the
baremetal port UUID.

Change-Id: Ie2bedda11ccf479db0cbc3dc51f100ae49f81bc2

public TLS for undercloud and is quite confusing. We recently

will use in clouds.yaml, that would default to empty string
assuming that the certificates are trusted.

commit_message:
Add new parameter PublicTLSCACert

We've been using InternalTLSCAFile parameter when enabling
public TLS for undercloud and is quite confusing. We recently
changed to use it in clouds.yaml and it would break when
both public and internal TLS are enabled for overcloud and both
use different CA certs. This adds a new parameter which we
will use in clouds.yaml, that would default to empty string
assuming that the certificates are trusted.

Closes-Bug: #1883818
Change-Id: Id6f612a91255b3158be821c363ca852c6b5d7496
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/737998

commit_message:
Use filter for containers not running check

Rather than using ansible task loops which increase the time to execute,
this change creates a filter that is used to assert that the containers
used in execs are running before we run the execs

Change-Id: I5e15cc71c45160109f5c303c13dd25a052ede3c3
(cherry picked from commit 2232a27ffbc0da1cab736a4a3cd79037bbad3ec1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-27 18:04:19.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Update to hieroglyph 2.0

hieroglyph 2.0 works with python 3, update to it.
Update some other requirements as well.

Cleanup tox.ini a bit.

DNM: If this works, let'S update docstheme options as well.

Change-Id: Ib8ba3e3f514688d06a07598e7d6ceffa79f26220
"}, {'created': '2020-06-27 18:29:03.000000000', 'message': "Update to hieroglyph 2.0

hieroglyph 2.0 works with python 3 and Sphinx 2, update to it.
Update some other requirements as well.

Cleanup tox.ini a bit.

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ib8ba3e3f514688d06a07598e7d6ceffa79f26220
"}]
commit_message:
Update to hieroglyph 2.0

hieroglyph 2.0 works with python 3 and Sphinx 2, update to it.
Update some other requirements as well.

Cleanup tox.ini a bit.

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ib8ba3e3f514688d06a07598e7d6ceffa79f26220

commit_message:
objects: Add MigrationTypeField

We use these things many places in the code and it would be good to have
constants to reference. Do just that.

Note that this results in a change in the object hash. However, there
are no actual changes in the output object so that's okay.

Change-Id: If02567ce0a3431dda5b2bf6d398bbf7cc954eed0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Release oslo for victoria serie - 2020 June 29

I proposed a minor version for castellan even if changes are a fix
because a new option was introduced.

Change-Id: Ia8a72bf0ce058c6b7f52db536eab0b0578c77431

commit_message:
Release Monasca-Agent 3.0.1

This includes a critical bugfix for Python 3 support in the Monasca Statsd
Agent service. The bugfix is referenced in the story below.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737929/
Change-Id: Ie14e7885fce5b09793c039ca5ba34cedac85c78b
Story: 2007684
Task: 39796

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-18 19:14:06.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports andit is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.
This approach was chosen after investigating
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1832021
and related bugs where using iptables rules for tcp checksum was
rendered as incorrect.

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b

commit_message:
Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b

commit_message:
Revert "Update cirros image to cirros-0.5.1"

This reverts commit 55e74bb8704d61081a419fc1c10df1bde73941d1.
Tempest tests are failing on master jobs with kernel panic
errors.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738210/ updates the RAM
requirements but we are reverting this change until
Tempset runs with cirros-0.5.1 are fully qualified.

Closes-Bug: #1885279
Change-Id: I703da322af8b540957b06975473cc523f39d598b

[{'created': '2020-06-18 19:25:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix etcd protocol configuration

The etcd service protocol is currently configured with internal_protocol.
The etcd service is not load balanced by a HAProxy container, so
there is no proxy layer to do TLS termination when internal_protocol
is configured to be "https".

Until the etcd service is configured to deploy with native TLS
termination, the etcd uses should be independent of
internal_protocol, and "http" by default.

commit_message:
Fix etcd protocol configuration

The etcd service protocol is currently configured with internal_protocol.
The etcd service is not load balanced by a HAProxy container, so
there is no proxy layer to do TLS termination when internal_protocol
is configured to be "https".

Until the etcd service is configured to deploy with native TLS
termination, the etcd uses should be independent of
internal_protocol, and "http" by default.

Change-Id: I730c02331514244e44004aa06e9399c01264c65d
Closes-Bug: 1884137

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.
- Remove unused babel.cfg and obsolete openstack-common.conf
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE.
- Remove six usage
- update to hacking 3.1.0, fix problems found.
- Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are
  blacklisted

Change-Id: I6321b612f37bca7b441171814b059eaad03d9f24

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Remove babel.cfg as well, this is the default role and not needed
anymore.

also remove Babel from requirements[1]
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I62987604eab277c05e22c963e76e3b8ab77da336

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
(cherry picked from commit 960993652e1ab526c1ce8cd3cd04d28f13facc86)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
(cherry picked from commit 960993652e1ab526c1ce8cd3cd04d28f13facc86)

[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:17:06.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Fix live migration

After live migrating a volume into the 3PAR driver the volume would be
unusable.  And we would no longer be able to do any operation with it.

Migrated in-use volumes cannot be renamed when migrated and therefore
need to use the "_name_id" field of the Volume object (volumes table in
the DB) to store the original volume's ID so the driver can locate the
volume.

The problem is that, even though the 3PAR driver sets the "_name_id"
field, it doesn't use it for any operation, so once the volume has been
migrated and the ID of the volume no longer matches the one that was
used to create the volume (value now in "_name_id") it will no longer be
able to locate the volume.

This patch adds the logic necessary to locate volumes using the
"_name_id" field.

Closes-Bug: #1697422
Change-Id: I27b9d4be419e1b52db02d4525b292ceeb5d5f867
(cherry picked from commit fc51678298a38dcd94bcfe92c590b38fdb7193e4)
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Fix live migration

After live migrating a volume into the 3PAR driver the volume would be
unusable.  And we would no longer be able to do any operation with it.

Migrated in-use volumes cannot be renamed when migrated and therefore
need to use the "_name_id" field of the Volume object (volumes table in
the DB) to store the original volume's ID so the driver can locate the
volume.

The problem is that, even though the 3PAR driver sets the "_name_id"
field, it doesn't use it for any operation, so once the volume has been
migrated and the ID of the volume no longer matches the one that was
used to create the volume (value now in "_name_id") it will no longer be
able to locate the volume.

This patch adds the logic necessary to locate volumes using the
"_name_id" field.

Closes-Bug: #1697422
Change-Id: I27b9d4be419e1b52db02d4525b292ceeb5d5f867
(cherry picked from commit fc51678298a38dcd94bcfe92c590b38fdb7193e4)

commit_message:
add "verify_ssl_path" config for barbican key manager

Now we cann't use the verify_ssl if we set True, so we
add the "verify_ssl_path" config to solve it.

Closes-Bug: #1876102
(cherry picked from commit 89f311dfbd264a5d4309ea1ca4283f2746d6fa24)

Change-Id: I83bafe5b7e0c4cca67f773858007fb59d98a93a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-28 16:35:43.000000000', 'message': 'Support deploying Elasticsearch Curator

This allows users to supply an Elasticsearch Curator actions file
to manage log retention [1]. Curator then runs on a cron job, which
defaults to every day. A default curator actions file is provided,
which can be customised by the end user if required.

The commit has been adapted for Train by changing the order in
"service enabled" - "hostname in group" logic to avoid inventory
issues for users not otherwise caring about the curator.

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/current/actionfile.html

Change-Id: Ide9baea9190ae849e61b9d8b6cff3305bdcdd534
(cherry picked from commit d4381456fda110a7cc2faa0d47b5bc0ae1352abc)
'}]
commit_message:
Support deploying Elasticsearch Curator

This allows users to supply an Elasticsearch Curator actions file
to manage log retention [1]. Curator then runs on a cron job, which
defaults to every day. A default curator actions file is provided,
which can be customised by the end user if required.

The commit has been adapted for Train by changing the order in
"service enabled" - "hostname in group" logic to avoid inventory
issues for users not otherwise caring about the curator.

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/current/actionfile.html

Change-Id: Ide9baea9190ae849e61b9d8b6cff3305bdcdd534
(cherry picked from commit d4381456fda110a7cc2faa0d47b5bc0ae1352abc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-04 02:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deleting stacks by id when waiting for result

When we want to wait for the result (wait=True), deleting a stack by
name works as expected. However, if deleting by id the stack is still
deleted but we get an error while polling events because no event is
ever found. This happens because the poller always compares the
resource_name attribute, which will never match the id.

This also required updating the tests as the fake events are always
created with the id as the resource_name and they assume that the
function is always called with the stack id and never the stack name.

Change-Id: Icd3a831faf14a45b1e492a0088160e519b5c6a02
Task: 30189
Story: 2005301

commit_message:
Fix deleting stacks by id when waiting for result

When we want to wait for the result (wait=True), deleting a stack by
name works as expected. However, if deleting by id the stack is still
deleted but we get an error while polling events because no event is
ever found. This happens because the poller always compares the
resource_name attribute, which will never match the id.

This also required updating the tests as the fake events are always
created with the id as the resource_name and they assume that the
function is always called with the stack id and never the stack name.

Change-Id: Icd3a831faf14a45b1e492a0088160e519b5c6a02
Task: 30189
Story: 2005301

> For me what it would make more sense is keep the value in the
 > ironic-inspector-base and change the parent of  ironic-inspector-tempest
 > to ironic-inspector-base wdyt?

That depends on the reason why we first used ironic-base as parent.
I see this as a way of having an inspector job here independent from jobs in ironic-inspector itself, which makes sense for example if we need to change the jobs in inspector for some reason, but still want to keep testing it here in the meantime.
This is just my opinion, I guess we should go back in time to understand why it is effectively like this.
I guess more opinions wanted :)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-06-29 11:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30100, 'date': '2020-06-29 13:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2020-05-29 14:58:20.000000000', 'message': "Doctor symptom for enabling caching logs

If the caching driver is improperly configured and keystone fails
to connect to it, it doesn't appear to be logged out even with
debug=true without enabling the debug level for caching itself.

Adding this doctor symptom so operators can know exactly what is
needed to see the caching logs in the Keystone side.

"}, {'created': '2020-05-29 15:11:40.000000000', 'message': "Doctor symptom for enabling caching logs

If the caching driver is improperly configured and keystone fails
to connect to it, it doesn't appear to be logged out even with
debug=true without enabling the debug level for caching itself.

commit_message:
Doctor symptom for enabling caching logs

If the caching driver is improperly configured and keystone fails
to connect to it, it doesn't appear to be logged out even with
debug=true without enabling the debug level for caching itself.

Adding this doctor symptom so operators can know exactly what is
needed to see the caching logs in the Keystone side.

Change-Id: I331e6024b6d6c618d7c29ab09bf9d183ee74f85b

commit_message:
Use filter for containers not running check

Rather than using ansible task loops which increase the time to execute,
this change creates a filter that is used to assert that the containers
used in execs are running before we run the execs

Change-Id: I5e15cc71c45160109f5c303c13dd25a052ede3c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-19 09:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'HPE 3PAR: Support duplicated FQDN in network

The 3PAR driver uses the FQDN of the node that is doing the
attach as an unique identifier to map the volume.

The problem is that the FQDN is not always unique, there are
environments where the same FQDN can be found in different systems, and
in those cases if both try to attach volumes the second system will
fail.

One example of this happening would be on a QA environment where you are
creating VMs and they all have names like controller-0.localdomain and
compute-0.localdomain.

This patch adds a configuration option to the 3PAR driver called
`unique_fqdn_network` to support these kind of environments.

Change-Id: I781144cbe68d6908333234a614e021365b0a6d4a
Closes-Bug: #1834695

commit_message:
HPE 3PAR: Support duplicated FQDN in network

The 3PAR driver uses the FQDN of the node that is doing the
attach as an unique identifier to map the volume.

The problem is that the FQDN is not always unique, there are
environments where the same FQDN can be found in different systems, and
in those cases if both try to attach volumes the second system will
fail.

One example of this happening would be on a QA environment where you are
creating VMs and they all have names like controller-0.localdomain and
compute-0.localdomain.

This patch adds a configuration option to the 3PAR driver called
`unique_fqdn_network` to support these kind of environments.

Change-Id: I781144cbe68d6908333234a614e021365b0a6d4a
Closes-Bug: #1834695

commit_message:
Wait for the project cleanup to complete

Currently the DAG will wait for the tasks to complete, except the last
group (which do not have other depends_on). This is bad from the OSC,
since we don't really know when it completes. Therefore let us try to
wait here until DAG is done.

Change-Id: I4c9af65de404fce62f25a4d453aabfcc9734e2a3

commit_message:
Trigger volume deletes only on volume deleted

It was possible to create a volume and to do the following operations
with the volume; at the end, the volume itself is marked as ended, but
the volume is still available.

openstack volume create --size x foo
openstack volume snapshot create --volume <id> foo_snap
openstack volume create --snapshot <id_of_snap> clone
openstack volume delete --purge <id_of_foo>

openstack metric resource show <id_of_foo>

This commit fixes that issue.

Change-Id: I55f0667c71ba4f3a33959a44bef43c3b05bc097c

[{'created': '2020-06-09 10:19:12.000000000', 'message': "drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I724a7cd7ce51ff2bdc365562e8b7b393b3ee74b6
"}]
commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I724a7cd7ce51ff2bdc365562e8b7b393b3ee74b6

Change-Id: I1e0333c0910cb2cfd1c412f21b1f5bd6db3b35e3
'}]
commit_message:
Improve messaging for required relations

At present the `certificates` relation will report as missing
until Vault is equipped with a root CA to issue certificates.

Change-Id: I1e0333c0910cb2cfd1c412f21b1f5bd6db3b35e3

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737384/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737826/

Change-Id: I4e03295548af5272a02ca81162fcd685c7986470

commit_message:
VMware: Attach volumes using adapter type from instance

Pick the adapter type from the instance VM instead of from the shadow
VM since attaching the volume to a different adapter type may change
the boot order.

Change-Id: I6d9c52b78f7e160b707334e98c282c7cbf1a0766

subject: Add default_log_levels to Mitaka and Ocata nova.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6737, 'name': 'Edward Hope-Morley', 'email': 'edward.hope-morley@canonical.com', 'username': 'hopem'}, {'_account_id': 10058, 'name': 'Erlon R. Cruz', 'email': 'erlon.rodrigues.cruz@canonical.com', 'username': 'sombrafam'}, {'_account_id': 10366, 'name': 'Hemanth N', 'email': 'hemanth.nakkina@canonical.com', 'username': 'Hemanth'}, {'_account_id': 19298, 'name': 'Nicolas Bock', 'email': 'nicolas.bock@canonical.com', 'username': 'nicolasbock'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24824, 'name': 'Dmitrii Shcherbakov', 'email': 'dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com', 'username': 'dmitriis'}, {'_account_id': 32029, 'name': 'likui', 'email': 'likui@yovole.com', 'username': 'likui'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-17 11:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-17 11:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-06-17 11:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2020-06-17 12:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2020-06-17 12:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-18 14:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2020-06-18 18:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-20 16:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Erlon, I really don't understand what you are asking so lets try another way.

As it stands, deploying nova-compute with this charm means that the Openstack default of INFO is used for oslo_messaging logs and the result of that is that, even if you set debug: true in the charm, you still won't see debug logs for oslo_messaging ... which is what I'm fixing here. The *only* way to fix this is to use the default_log_levels config in Nova and the *only* way to configure that is to provide the whole string from upstream with any changes you need applied. So there is no other way to do this (that i'm aware of)."}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-06-21 03:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-22 09:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I believe newton and ocata templates need modification as well. Otherwise looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-22 10:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dmitrii, the ocata template change is already included. Ill add Newton.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2020-06-22 14:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I get your point. Sorry for the confusion. My second statement
about the debugging was just that it would be nice to have a
way to set the debug for the individual libraries as we need them.
For example, if we had a charm config let's say 'oslo_debug_libraries',
we would set what from that list (on default_log_levels) we
would want to debug, so, the next time we need to debug amqp, for example, we wouldn't need to go and add a patch for that.

But I don't have a hard feeling about that. It would be an 
improvement. Up to you to ponder how much it would worth to
invest time on that."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-23 11:58:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Erlon, got it, now i see what you are saying. I'm in two minds about adding a new config opt for this. If we add a config opt for oslo debug levels then what happens when someone wants to set one of the others that are not oslo. Remember you can always override any of these with the existing config_flags option so I think lets stick what that for now."}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2020-06-23 12:27:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So, yeah, I said 'oslo' debug libraries, but it does not need to
be only oslo. It could be 'libs_log_levels', or something in those lines, we would just get this from the charm and would set it to nova.conf and default values for the charm would be what we currently have in _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-23 12:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-23 12:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-25 11:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-25 11:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Erlon, remember that one of the founding principles of charms is opinionated configuration. If we add config options for everything it becomes unweildy to use and hard to test. That's not to say that i disagree entirely with what you are asking for but in this patch lets keep the distinction between "could" and "should". We could allow for any of these to be set somehow but this patch is saying that we should at the very least always enable debug for the ones being set in this patch. Remember you can always override anything using the existing config-flags options.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-25 13:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2020-06-25 13:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-29 10:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add default_log_levels to Mitaka and Ocata nova.conf

If debug is enabled we will also want oslo_messaging
debug logs and this allows for that. A previous patch
added this for >= Pike but it is also needed if these
logs are wanted in >= Mitaka.

Related-Bug: #1817290

Change-Id: I168bd04e3a0332d2ed2a74e411ead3df101402c4

debug logs and this allows for that. A previous patch
added this for >= Pike but it is also needed if these

Related-Bug: #1817290

commit_message:
Add default_log_levels to Mitaka and Ocata nova.conf

If debug is enabled we will also want oslo_messaging
debug logs and this allows for that. A previous patch
added this for >= Pike but it is also needed if these
logs are wanted in >= Mitaka.

Change-Id: I8d916e6082ee6fa6140406e1f69bab6bde01b65e
Related-Bug: #1817290

messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-06-23 02:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-06-25 07:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 02:14:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Ie1ce41d54f5615490128e6845b28837325e2feda
'}]
commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Ie1ce41d54f5615490128e6845b28837325e2feda

commit_message:
Remove enforcer

It was a great idea, but it doesn't work with modern sphinx. The
approach it took is actually untennable - sphinx does not produce
output that makes it possible to look for the thing this is looking
for.

Change-Id: I7e1c6f12c643b7aa7bfc489dfdc188ac256073cf

subject: Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-27 07:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-27 07:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-27 07:31:53.000000000', 'message': "Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3
(cherry picked from commit 31f3f848597b7d26b67881ff1ff3794f334aa24a)
"}]
commit_message:
Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3
(cherry picked from commit 31f3f848597b7d26b67881ff1ff3794f334aa24a)

commit_message:
Run tox in venv in case of building images

tox depends on virtualenv, when it's installed using pip - it tries to upgrade
virtualenv, and then fails.

Change-Id: Ic9566778f87f8b81563ed012e651cef50d1baa38
(cherry picked from commit f3ba8d5f237b2d275b44f7b12942966edad36a84)

I see there is nothing about API or DB schema changes, so there won't be any limitation on what can happen on non-named releases, correct?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-05 15:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-06 11:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-05-13 21:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks Dmitry, LGTM'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-05-19 07:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-05-19 07:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

thanks'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-05-26 13:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The release team discussed this on its last meeting[1].

Extra branches should not cause major problems. We might need to adjust the tooling to make sure you can create branches and tags with the openstack/releases tooling, but in the worst case scenario we could do those extra branches and tags manually.

To keep the branch naming consistent, we should try out git symbolic-refs and again check that the tooling does not hate it. To reduce the changes in release tooling we'd probably make the stable/victoria branch the "real thing" while stable/17.x would be the symbolic link.

Sean pointed out the extra work needed to backport fixes. When you backport to stein, currently you only have to also backport to ussuri and train. With this model you would have to backport to all the extra branches in between. Are you ready for that extra work ? How long do you maintain those extra branches ?

fungi also raised a point around integrated testing and matching branches, but I'll let him summarize that.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/releaseteam/2020/releaseteam.2020-05-14-16.00.log.html#l-83'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-26 13:33:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Thierry, thank you very much for your input.

This part addresses the intermediate branches:

> Other stable branches (for deliverables that have them) are supported for 6 months or the next named release, whatever happens later. Only high and critical bug fixes are accepted during the whole support time.

So they'll be more short-lived and will receive potentially fewer patches. This proposal also suggests limiting how many things we backport to regular branches after some initial support time.

Due to how short-lived the branches are, we expect their CI to use whatever release was master at the moment of branching. E.g. anything branched from master now will use master/victoria till its EOL.

I should have also clarified that the intermediate branches will receive no extended maintenance."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-26 13:53:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

From my local testing, it didn't appear symbolic-refs could be pushed up and shared. This means each branch will need to be a full independent branch. Which means backporting bugfixes will need to go through every branch individually. Just be aware of the extra work this is going to incur.

As far as release tooling though, we should be able to support additional branches."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-05-26 13:59:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Dmitry Tantsur wrote:
[...]
> Due to how short-lived the branches are, we expect their CI to use
> whatever release was master at the moment of branching. E.g.
> anything branched from master now will use master/victoria till its
> EOL.
[...]

This will likely work fine while Victoria is still under active development, but once stable/victoria is branched you'll need to start maintaining a mapping table in your job definitions so that, e.g., Ironic stable/15.1 and stable/16.0 branch changes will be tested with stable/victoria code and changes for coordinated release projects. With three coordinated stable branches under maintenance at any given time and two intermediate Ironic stable branches per cycle that's only six overrides you need to track, but if maintenance periods lengthen or the frequency of intermediate branches increases that could get a but unweildy. It's also harder if you want to have changes for coordinated release projects test with non-matching branch names for Ironic. I don't think it's possible, just keep a very close eye on your integration testing and check build logs to make sure you're really exercising the branch combinations you think you are."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-05-26 14:02:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Jeremy Stanley wrote:
[...]
> I don't think it's possible
[...]"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-05-26 14:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Sorry, I meant to say "I don't think it's IMpossible." *sigh*'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-05-26 17:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> So they'll be more short-lived and will receive potentially fewer
> patches.

I'd like to make sure I understand this correctly. Let's take a practical example.

Currently we have stable/train, stable/ussuri. If we backport something to stable/train, we have to backport it to stable/ussuri as well, otherwise people upgrading would get a regression.

Now with a model where we'd have stable/ussuri (=15.x), stable/16.x (no longer maintained), stable/17.x, stable/victoria (=18.x), stable/19.x. If you backport a fix to stable/ussuri, you need to backport it to all the other 3 branches still under maintenance. If you do "fewer patches" on the intermediary branches, that means not backporting some of the fixes. So someone upgrading from 15.x (stable/ussuri) to 17.x would get regressions ?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 08:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> So someone upgrading from 15.x (stable/ussuri) to 17.x would get regressions ?

Yes, we cannot rule that out. It's unfortunate, but it seems to be a reasonable compromise. Note that this situation is already possible right now, if somebody upgrades from stable/ussuri to any V release."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 09:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think the key here is to carefully manage perceptions around two types of branches. The current "named" branches should be positioned as they are now: long-term support branches you can stick to.

The new intermediate branches should NOT be positioned as such, but rather as a technical way for us to produce a bug fix for an intermediate release even if master has already diverged.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 09:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Or another way to think about it (sorry for spamming): named branches are release series, but releases from intermediate branches are still part of the series they got branched from (e.g. releases from stable/17.x are part of Victoria).

I wonder if we can teach reno to treat them this way...'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-05-27 09:08:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Note that this situation is already
 > possible right now, if somebody upgrades from stable/ussuri to any
 > V release.

Hmm, you should never get a regression in the current model. Any backport needs to land in master first. And any stein backport should be first pushed to train and ussuri.

I'm a bit concerned about introducing a model that would potentially allow regressions on upgrades... Or are you saying that people using the intermediary versions should never ever upgrade ?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 09:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Hmm, you should never get a regression in the current model. Any backport needs to land in master first. And any stein backport should be first pushed to train and ussuri.

You're only considering the named releases, but we also have intermediate releases right now. For example, if you upgrade from stable/train to 14.0 (mid-Ussuri), you'll likely lose some bug fixes. The only thing that this proposal changes is the possibility of 14.0.1 with some more fixes (but still probably not everything that stable/train has).

> I'm a bit concerned about introducing a model that would potentially allow regressions on upgrades... Or are you saying that people using the intermediary versions should never ever upgrade ?

No, definitely not that, but they should be careful (and we'll need to highlight this in the upgrade docs) when switching away from an LTS aka named branch to a random release.

You're still thinking about new intermediate branches as full equivalent of the existing named branches, but this is not the intention (and I guess my wording is at fault for that).

Imagine, right after 14.0 we found a serious bug, and immediately issued 14.0.1 with a fix from master. I want the new branches to serve the same role without depending on what has already merged to master.

The messaging around new branches won't look like "here is a branch you can follow", but more of "we found a critical issue in 17.0.0 and released 17.0.1 with a fix". No promises to contain other fixes.

I hope it makes sense now.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-05-27 11:49:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yes it makes sense, thanks for the explanation.

If the branches will behave so differently, I think it's fine to keep LTS ones named stable/victoria and the intermediary ones named stable/17.x to clearly distinguish between them. (It's looking like symbolic-refs cannot be pushed/pulled so we can't play with that)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 12:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I wonder if we should even avoid the name "stable", although it will probably cause troubles with automation. Just release/17.x?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-27 12:47:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> The new intermediate branches should NOT be positioned as such, but
 > rather as a technical way for us to produce a bug fix for an
 > intermediate release even if master has already diverged.

Can you explain why the current model can't be used and a stable release done? If Ironic does a release 14.5.6, the next cycle should be at a minimum 14.6.0. So there is still the opportunity to release a stable version of 14.5.7, 14.5.8, etc."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-27 12:49:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Can you explain why the current model can't be used and a stable release done?

I'm talking about releases from master that do not correspond to a branch currently (e.g. 14.0.0 was released in the middle of ussuri).

I agree re versions, I don't think it contradicts anything that I've said though."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-05-27 17:12:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > Can you explain why the current model can't be used and a stable
 > release done?
 > 
 > I'm talking about releases from master that do not correspond to a
 > branch currently (e.g. 14.0.0 was released in the middle of
 > ussuri).
 > 
 > I agree re versions, I don't think it contradicts anything that
 > I've said though.

That seems to be the fundamental disconnect, at least as I interpret Sean's question."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-05-27 17:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1

Approving with workflow +1. I believe Dmitry intends to post a follow-up based on some of the discussion. Please note that this approval does not mean that this has been implemented.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-06-29 09:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Update posted: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738408/'}]

subject: Fix parsing of StatsD metrics with Py3
messages: [{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-06-25 08:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 08:54:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix parsing of StatsD metrics with Py3

When running with Py3 we compare a byte string to a unicode string
when parsing StatsD metrics. This patch adds some unit tests to
reproduce the bug and decodes the bytestring to make the existing
comparisons valid under Py3. When backporting to Train we can use
Oslo encodeutils. Clearly we could have more unit tests, but
this makes a start.

Change-Id: I6341f96f5c186428d2d829cabf618a6f84f40ce2
Story: 2007684
Task: 39796
(cherry picked from commit a2400fcf121a30f9fe78bef1c73e32b5eed48ea6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parsing of StatsD metrics with Py3

When running with Py3 we compare a byte string to a unicode string
when parsing StatsD metrics. This patch adds some unit tests to
reproduce the bug and decodes the bytestring to make the existing
comparisons valid under Py3. When backporting to Train we can use
Oslo encodeutils. Clearly we could have more unit tests, but
this makes a start.

Change-Id: I6341f96f5c186428d2d829cabf618a6f84f40ce2
Story: 2007684
Task: 39796
(cherry picked from commit a2400fcf121a30f9fe78bef1c73e32b5eed48ea6)

commit_message:
Remove artg_repos_dir var from testenv config

artg_repos_dir var when used in release file in downstream, is not
getting overridden leading to failure in build test packages.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727200 moves the artg_repos_dir
var under defaults in build test packages roles. So removing it
from here so that it can be overridden from release file.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1789

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727200

Change-Id: I6d97b7d26e58e77843ed201fcd2efede2da3c8f5
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Dependencies needed by openvswitch are not present on
the rdo-release-train-1 rpm. We need to update it
to make sure they're present.

commit_message:
Force the  buffer to flush after each print

The info of print() is first output to the buffer and will not be printed
if the buffer is not full.
Use flush() to force the  buffer to flush after each print

Change-Id: I548962fb43043e4b9991892d354aed192aebf7c1

commit_message:
Remove auto-reverse option from IPA server setup

The inclusion of --auto-reverse in the IPA server
setup command is causing errors on certains clouds where
the zone being created already exists and is owned by
some other dns server.

This review reoves the --auto-reverse to prevent
errors on these clouds.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737998/
Change-Id: Iaaf44b007a252d1dcbcaacc081c05e80105c2b0a
Closes-Bug: #1884287

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I05cd9dcf68ff329b37b2db824b421c097546442e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:51:58.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I8d02f93eef73af901b6d423e34806e28588d46f4
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I8d02f93eef73af901b6d423e34806e28588d46f4

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it

Change-Id: Ia6a63bce0a1062e0ecd1f2f3bea3f8e4502e7190
"}]
commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ia6a63bce0a1062e0ecd1f2f3bea3f8e4502e7190

[{'created': '2020-05-08 16:38:31.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix failback failing after service restart

After a successful failover, if the volume service was restarted,
the driver wouldn't be able to failback to the primary cluster
due to incomplete cluster data.

This patch address this problem by gathering data from the
primary cluster during the failback procedure.

Change-Id: I796fcf8969adae3338861a1b2f3310fafcacfbcb
Closes-bug: #1859653
(cherry picked from commit f24eb2fc630f32697fd9afdfdec97e0f61493a46)
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix failback failing after service restart

After a successful failover, if the volume service was restarted,
the driver wouldn't be able to failback to the primary cluster
due to incomplete cluster data.

This patch address this problem by gathering data from the
primary cluster during the failback procedure.

Change-Id: I796fcf8969adae3338861a1b2f3310fafcacfbcb
Closes-bug: #1859653
(cherry picked from commit f24eb2fc630f32697fd9afdfdec97e0f61493a46)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - RDF State Validation Enhancements

Update exception message for volumes being missing from
their management storage groups for additional clarity.
Add RDF state validation call during extend volume
operations if the volume is replication enabled.
Add additional validation check for comparing device
count in local and remote RDF groups to ensure they
match.

Change-Id: Ib4e7fb0a1a42fd2da8ee6244d78a16c308bfd1c1

commit_message:
Fix incorrect pxe-enabled was set during introspection

Morden bare metals usually support PXEs from all NICs, in
our current logic only the port matching mac address in the
BOOTIF will be set to pxe-enabled. This does not work for UEFI
nor user friendly to bonding.

This patch adds a configuration option [processing]update_pxe_enabled
to control whether this field should be updated according to
introspection data, defaults to False to keep backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I6f3b00180f62dc6f500ac2cdb5d8f8cc7c7190cf

commit_message:
Fix targetcli install error on ubuntu focal

No targetcli package on Ubuntu Focal, it should use targetcli-fb also
when "$CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER" == "lioadm".

Although Xenial only has targetcli, but Xenial is dropped from CI. And
starting from bionic, Ubuntu uses targetcli-fb to replace targetcli. So
here we can use is_ubuntu to make ubuntu use targetcli-fb.

Change-Id: I6d35b6651d486e716980dcd9f4d693bed560463a

commit_message:
Add Elasticsearch Curator Docker image

Kolla provides log aggregation, but no solution to set retention periods
for aggregated logs. It therefore accumulates log data indefinitely unless
a user manually intervenes. This change adds Elasticsearch Curator which
provides a mechanism for automating such retention periods [1].

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/current/about.html

The container contains cron to support running Curator periodically.

Change-Id: Ief2c554a64ef6cc971635d7e2a718f63c310fbf6

commit_message:
Use internalURL endpoint_type for all clients used by Magnum

Magnum, Cinder and Octavia clients in Magnum now use endpoint_type of
internalURL by default consistent with other clients also used by the
conductor. Additionally, they also use the globally defined
`openstack_region_name` for region_name.

Closes-Bug: #1885096

Change-Id: Ibec511013760cc4f681a2ec1b769b532be3daf2d
(cherry picked from commit eb24945d75379952d0988403f3ed4bb9203f2113)

commit_message:
Validate that snat namespace exits in _create_dvr_gateway

During rescheduling dvr router snat namespace may not be
created due to race between router added and router
updated updated notifications.

Verify that snat namespace exits or create one.

Partial-bug: 1881995

Change-Id: Ic28ce249d59264b0b882bd1cc3c9fb55854a6a47

commit_message:
Add "igmp_snooping_enable" config option for OVS agent

Neutron-ovs-agent can now enable IGMP snooping in integration bridge
if config option "igmp_snooping_enable" in OVS section in config will
be set to True.
It will also set mcast-snooping-disable-flood-unregistered=true
so flooding of multicast packets to all unregistered ports will be
disabled also.
Both changes are applied on integration bridge.

Change-Id: I12f4030a35d10d1715d3b4bfb3ed5efb9aa28f2b
Closes-Bug: #1840136
(cherry picked from commit 5b341150e29137e3dab671453a9a6c0908e74585)

[{'created': '2020-06-25 11:04:46.000000000', 'message': "Improve error reporting in password utilities

The kolla-genpwd and kolla-mergepwd commands can be used to manipulate
the kolla passwords.yml file. The format is a YAML encoded dict of
password variable names to their values. If the format is not a dict,
the error messages are unhelpful.  In particular, this can happen if the
file is encrypted e.g. via Ansible Vault.

For kolla-genpwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'items'

For kolla-mergepwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'update'

This change adds a more friendly message.

commit_message:
Improve error reporting in password utilities

The kolla-genpwd and kolla-mergepwd commands can be used to manipulate
the kolla passwords.yml file. The format is a YAML encoded dict of
password variable names to their values. If the format is not a dict,
the error messages are unhelpful.  In particular, this can happen if the
file is encrypted e.g. via Ansible Vault.

For kolla-genpwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'items'

For kolla-mergepwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'update'

This change adds a more friendly message.

Change-Id: I27f0835b904e05006ae401adf383090322e1b891
Closes-Bug: #1880220
(cherry picked from commit 620b808cf366596d7cdd521cd5b44a973d5cdeab)
(cherry picked from commit d8b05f4c1a81609451f49a76c3e29d9d15a21f76)

commit_message:
Remove chrony package if containerized chrony is enabled

This patch is removing chrony package
from docker host when containerized chrony is enabled.
It is also fixing issue with chrony container running
under Ubuntu docker host as noted below.

+ exec /usr/sbin/chronyd -d -f /etc/chrony/chrony.conf
2020-06-08T08:19:09Z chronyd version 3.4 starting (+CMDMON +NTP +REFCLOCK +RTC +PRIVDROP +SCFILTER +SIGND +ASYNCDNS +SECHASH +IPV6 -DEBUG)
2020-06-08T08:19:09Z Fatal error : Could not open configuration file /etc/chrony/chrony.conf : Permission denied

Added also removal apparmor profile for ubuntu when
containerized chrony is enabled, as chrony's package
is not removing apparmor profile, and therefore
containerized chrony is not working.

Change-Id: Icf3bbae38b9f5630b69d5c8cf6a8bee11786a836
Closes-Bug: #1882513
(cherry picked from commit 3d747b720051ed053f2e36b5679862b92265443b)

commit_message:
Remove post_config from the Kibana role

Since at least Stein, there is no visible effect from these tasks.
The Kibana dashboard seems to be working exactly the same,
greeting user on the first use with "please configure my index".
I tested on both Ubuntu and CentOS.
In new E*K stack (Ussuri+, CentOS8+) it even causes play errors.

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iafc6986cce9cbaa0ea9e219ca85d7d01a61308cf
Closes-Bug: #1799689
(cherry picked from commit fbc47e60e1ce0f371c3f9e4350d5581c98d7b393)

commit_message:
Use internalURL endpoint_type for all clients used by Magnum

Magnum, Cinder and Octavia clients in Magnum now use endpoint_type of
internalURL by default consistent with other clients also used by the
conductor. Additionally, they also use the globally defined
`openstack_region_name` for region_name.

Closes-Bug: #1885096

Change-Id: Ibec511013760cc4f681a2ec1b769b532be3daf2d
(cherry picked from commit eb24945d75379952d0988403f3ed4bb9203f2113)

commit_message:
Use internalURL endpoint_type for all clients used by Magnum

Magnum, Cinder and Octavia clients in Magnum now use endpoint_type of
internalURL by default consistent with other clients also used by the
conductor. Additionally, they also use the globally defined
`openstack_region_name` for region_name.

Closes-Bug: #1885096

Change-Id: Ibec511013760cc4f681a2ec1b769b532be3daf2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-26 19:24:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch[1] that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173
(cherry picked from commit 40731e572f2b503a3ccc603642a3721a5ce1cf7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch[1] that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173
(cherry picked from commit 40731e572f2b503a3ccc603642a3721a5ce1cf7a)

commit_message:
Remove api_servers references

cyborg thankfully did not import the api_servers config option from
nova. That's awesome, because it's going away anyway.

This is step one in a set of patches to improve glance interactions
by increasing use of sdk. By itself it should be completely no-op.

Change-Id: I87d38acb350b03d735ba1e5d4f79b6fbbea4314e

commit_message:
add special function to ProviderTree and _Provier

this change adds __iter__, __repr__, __len__
__contians__, __bool__ and __getitem__ to
ProviderTree and _Provier classes
and refacotors find, get_provider_uuids
other functions that should use the iterator
to do so.

This change shold not affect the observeable
behavior of existing functions but will
enable more pythonic usage.
- if uuid_or_name in provider_tree
vs provider_tree.exits(uuid_or_name)
- provider_tree[name_or_uuid] vs
provider_tree._find_with_lock(name_or_uuid)

addtionally the __repr__ functions impove
debuging or logging by makeing the objects
printable.

Change-Id: I3d340ac02f94631dc9dd67155556439f638ba5b9

commit_message:
Switch to new bind method in BaseResourceFilter

The bind method already contains the 'force_scheduling' parameter in
BaseResourceFilter and has been released, so it can be switched to a
new form.

Change-Id: I0fd56d83ed8076d701a2a96f0bf923e544ed5463

[{'created': '2020-06-27 07:32:41.000000000', 'message': "Verify TLS by default for Kibana to Elasticsearch

Currently, if internal TLS communication is enabled, Kibana to
Elasticsearch communication is unverified. This is because we set
elasticsearch.ssl.verificationMode to 'none' by default (via
kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify). This is poor a security
posture.

This change changes the default value of

commit_message:
Verify TLS by default for Kibana to Elasticsearch

Currently, if internal TLS communication is enabled, Kibana to
Elasticsearch communication is unverified. This is because we set
elasticsearch.ssl.verificationMode to 'none' by default (via
kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify). This is poor a security
posture.

This change changes the default value of
'kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify' to 'true'.

Change-Id: Ie4fa8e3a60d69cf5c4bdd975030c92be8113ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1885110
(cherry picked from commit e91fd969ace4c83cd461378419dd6aa96399edc2)

commit_message:
Verify TLS by default for Kibana to Elasticsearch

Currently, if internal TLS communication is enabled, Kibana to
Elasticsearch communication is unverified. This is because we set
elasticsearch.ssl.verificationMode to 'none' by default (via
kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify). This is poor a security
posture.

This change changes the default value of
'kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify' to 'true'.

Change-Id: Ie4fa8e3a60d69cf5c4bdd975030c92be8113ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1885110
(cherry picked from commit e91fd969ace4c83cd461378419dd6aa96399edc2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-27 07:31:47.000000000', 'message': "Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3
(cherry picked from commit 31f3f848597b7d26b67881ff1ff3794f334aa24a)
"}]
commit_message:
Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3
(cherry picked from commit 31f3f848597b7d26b67881ff1ff3794f334aa24a)

commit_message:
Upload image via interop import if needed

We have support for interop import already, but it's not stitched
in to the image upload call. Add support for using it.

We're adding this as a fallback for the case that PUT is turned off
due to operator concerns about the need for scratch space. That
means we don't want existing users to all of a sudden start uploading
via import. However, if they do want to use import, we want that
to work, so there is now a flag.

Change-Id: I26e7ba5704d58a21f7ae2011e8c21e9b9310751a

commit_message:
Don't use random.SystemRandom in tests

We do not need cryptographically secure random content for throwaway
test content.

Change-Id: Ic65aebbd686fcc1584d7c3dbeedc5eb0f6b1341c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-26 19:24:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch[1] that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173
(cherry picked from commit 40731e572f2b503a3ccc603642a3721a5ce1cf7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch[1] that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173
(cherry picked from commit 40731e572f2b503a3ccc603642a3721a5ce1cf7a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 10:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'L3 agent scheduler should return a valid index if manual scheduling

When retrieving a vacant L3 agent binding index, if
"is_manual_scheduling" is set, the method "get_vacant_binding_index"
should always return a valid binding index. If the existing binding
indexes are sequentially aligned, the method will return a new one
on top; if there is a gap in the binding indexes list, the first
free index will be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1884906

Change-Id: I0a89bca0734d3e735fb357e488f85589e81d709f
'}, {'created': '2020-06-24 15:37:44.000000000', 'message': 'L3 agent scheduler should return a valid index if manual scheduling

When retrieving a vacant L3 agent binding index, if
"is_manual_scheduling" is set, the method "get_vacant_binding_index"

commit_message:
L3 agent scheduler should return a valid index if manual scheduling

When retrieving a vacant L3 agent binding index, if
"is_manual_scheduling" is set, the method "get_vacant_binding_index"
should always return a valid binding index. If the existing binding
indexes are sequentially aligned, the method will return a new one
on top; if there is a gap in the binding indexes list, the first
free index will be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1884906

Change-Id: I0a89bca0734d3e735fb357e488f85589e81d709f

commit_message:
Prepare for dropping keystone admin endpoint

Keystone no longer has any special functionality hidden behind the admin
endpoint. Stop referencing it in consumers, so it can later be dropped
completely.

Change-Id: I04a5d77908005268cc7c59e7e9ddeea70f6732e2

DhcpFilter should always return a valid index if "force_scheduling"

WHen retrieving a vacant DHCP agent binding index, if
"force_scheduling" is set, the method should return a valid binding
index. If the existing binding indexes are sequentially aligned,

commit_message:
Provide integer number to arping "-w" parameter

Some arping versions only accept an integer number for the
"deadline" (-w) parameter.

Change-Id: Ie21c9b5820262d049c0fcd8147d85cc110d88272
Closes-Bug: #1885169

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 14:10:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix default openstack_deploy dir evaluation

The default is broken because lookup from a missing env var returns
an empty string. Unless the 2nd parameter 'true' is passed to
default, it only defaults undefined variables. An empty string is
not undefined, so the default never works.

In group_vars/all/all.yml, it doesn't matter that the default never
works, because openstack-ansible.rc always sets OSA_CONFIG_DIR.

In get-ansible-role-requirements.yml, it makes a difference, because
the first time this playbook runs during bootstrap,
openstack-ansible.rc will not be loaded yet. This means the default
user roles path is always going to be '/user-role-requirements.yml'
instead of '/etc/openstack_deploy/user-role-requirements.yml'.

Change-Id: Id9e53958daf9494e5baf9cd1e34ed6f83eefa5f4
(cherry picked from commit e9c33c1c002e517b23624b66a127a0dc80a3897e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default openstack_deploy dir evaluation

The default is broken because lookup from a missing env var returns
an empty string. Unless the 2nd parameter 'true' is passed to
default, it only defaults undefined variables. An empty string is
not undefined, so the default never works.

In group_vars/all/all.yml, it doesn't matter that the default never
works, because openstack-ansible.rc always sets OSA_CONFIG_DIR.

In get-ansible-role-requirements.yml, it makes a difference, because
the first time this playbook runs during bootstrap,
openstack-ansible.rc will not be loaded yet. This means the default
user roles path is always going to be '/user-role-requirements.yml'
instead of '/etc/openstack_deploy/user-role-requirements.yml'.

Change-Id: Id9e53958daf9494e5baf9cd1e34ed6f83eefa5f4
(cherry picked from commit e9c33c1c002e517b23624b66a127a0dc80a3897e)

commit_message:
barbican: Use python3 plugin in uwsgi config

backport: ussuri, train

Backport note: adapted for mixed py2/3.

Without this the container returns an empty response.

Change-Id: Ic36845f3fc625c080c92904b58ace070dd24fbb2
Closes-Bug: #1881784
(cherry picked from commit 895c86a846181f6ee125aa2ddadf77a1891efe88)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 10:08:25.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor tempest plugin install from source

Previously the tempest plugins were installed using pip independant
of the python_venv_build role, in the past OSA could support a mixed install
of a distro tempest package and source code plugins. The mixed mode has been
removed but the tempest & tempest plugins installation tasks remain seperate.

Tempest is installed using python_venv_build, and the plugins are installed
directly using the ansible pip module. Unfortunatly, these two approaches do
not handle openstack upper-constraints in the same way, particularly for a
package that is installed from source code.

The python_venv_build role will correctly install a version of tempest
corresponding to the specified git SHA even when u-c specifies an earlier version
of the package. Unfortunately, when installing the tempest plugins with
the pip module, the previously installed tempest packages gets downgraded to
match the version specified in u-c as the pip module is unaware of the combined
source + u-c constraints generated by python_venv_build.

Tempest is an unusual case, because it is perhaps the only "top level" openstack
projects which has its own constraint appear in u-c.

This patch also corrects the use use of the venv_wheel_build_enable variable.
As a role default the value of this variable is changed in the whole scope of
the role becasue it is overridden during the stackviz install. The approach
used should be reviewed and refined in a future patch.

Change-Id: I5e8c8540b30865aaccafe59c73fae6fdd6da80a8
(cherry picked from commit 0317e9fc0291d340c2f3c99c7fcb821ea5452f4a)
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor tempest plugin install from source

Previously the tempest plugins were installed using pip independant
of the python_venv_build role, in the past OSA could support a mixed install
of a distro tempest package and source code plugins. The mixed mode has been
removed but the tempest & tempest plugins installation tasks remain seperate.

Tempest is installed using python_venv_build, and the plugins are installed
directly using the ansible pip module. Unfortunatly, these two approaches do
not handle openstack upper-constraints in the same way, particularly for a
package that is installed from source code.

The python_venv_build role will correctly install a version of tempest
corresponding to the specified git SHA even when u-c specifies an earlier version
of the package. Unfortunately, when installing the tempest plugins with
the pip module, the previously installed tempest packages gets downgraded to
match the version specified in u-c as the pip module is unaware of the combined
source + u-c constraints generated by python_venv_build.

Tempest is an unusual case, because it is perhaps the only "top level" openstack
projects which has its own constraint appear in u-c.

This patch also corrects the use use of the venv_wheel_build_enable variable.
As a role default the value of this variable is changed in the whole scope of
the role becasue it is overridden during the stackviz install. The approach
used should be reviewed and refined in a future patch.

Change-Id: I5e8c8540b30865aaccafe59c73fae6fdd6da80a8
(cherry picked from commit 0317e9fc0291d340c2f3c99c7fcb821ea5452f4a)
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
hardware: Rework 'get_realtime_constraint'

Rework 'get_realtime_constraint' so that it can do the work previously
split between this and 'vcpus_realtime_topology', eliminating the need
for the latter. This provides a model for how we can parse the
'hw:cpu_dedicated_mask' extra spec in the future.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: I3a2132db258202afe5cfa0eb95e6905030314f98
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 09:35:36.000000000', 'message': "Verify TLS by default for Kibana to Elasticsearch

Currently, if internal TLS communication is enabled, Kibana to
Elasticsearch communication is unverified. This is because we set
elasticsearch.ssl.verificationMode to 'none' by default (via
kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify). This is poor a security
posture.

This change changes the default value of
'kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify' to 'true'.

Change-Id: Ie4fa8e3a60d69cf5c4bdd975030c92be8113ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1885110
"}]
commit_message:
Verify TLS by default for Kibana to Elasticsearch

Currently, if internal TLS communication is enabled, Kibana to
Elasticsearch communication is unverified. This is because we set
elasticsearch.ssl.verificationMode to 'none' by default (via
kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify). This is poor a security
posture.

This change changes the default value of
'kibana_elasticsearch_ssl_verify' to 'true'.

Change-Id: Ie4fa8e3a60d69cf5c4bdd975030c92be8113ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1885110

[{'created': '2020-06-25 09:35:36.000000000', 'message': "Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3
"}]
commit_message:
Support CA certificate for fluentd & Elasticsearch

Currently there is no way to configure a CA certificate bundle file for
fluentd to Elasticsearch communication. This change adds a new variable,
'fluentd_elasticsearch_cacert' with a default value set to the value of
'openstack_cacert.

Closes-Bug: #1885109

Change-Id: I5bbf55a4dd4ccce9fa2635cee720139c088268e3

generate-constraints -b blacklist.txt -p /usr/bin/python3.6 -p \
  /usr/bin/python3.8 -r global-requirements.txt > upper-constraints.txt

cleared up salt (3001 should work with py38) and the normal mock,
msgpack (because of salt) and docutils (because of boto iirc)

held back oslotest for mock issues

held back jsonpatch for ironic failures

Change-Id: I5b1ad154d8287a46728da4c0b3c13905c1391925
'}]
commit_message:
manual upper-constraints run

generated via:

generate-constraints -b blacklist.txt -p /usr/bin/python3.6 -p \
  /usr/bin/python3.8 -r global-requirements.txt > upper-constraints.txt

cleared up salt (3001 should work with py38) and the normal mock,
msgpack (because of salt) and docutils (because of boto iirc)

held back oslotest for mock issues

held back jsonpatch for ironic failures

Change-Id: I5b1ad154d8287a46728da4c0b3c13905c1391925

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-19 00:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-19 12:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks mel :D'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-19 16:09:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm, we're just pending a change to *actually* test the console from now on"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-19 16:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-19 17:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:
