recheck dep updated'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-31 03:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-31 13:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looks like the containerized jobs are failing because the Tempest tests fail to verify the SSL certificate (and they are self-signed)...'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-31 13:10:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

aw man, i'm not sure we can test the tempest checked out in here.. or maybe we could.. i need to check :("}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-31 16:09:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

FWIW, there's a tempest conf setting: disable_ssl_certificate_validation = False that is supposed to be set to True [1] if using self-signed certificates:

http://logs.openstack.org/42/671642/3/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-centos-7/d0f4f10/logs/etc/openstack/aio1_utility_container-bf78a4db/tempest/tempest.conf.txt.gz

The last thing I did was try out a patch to tempest that makes the urllib3.PoolManager() used to call the novnc proxy leverage the config settings for ssl cert validation:

https://review.opendev.org/673723

but things are still failing, presumably because we're not setting the tempest.conf disable_ssl_certificate_validation = True for this environment with self-signed certs.

That said, I don't understand why every other test *is* passing though, considering the tempest.conf setting + self-signed certs.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/sampleconf.html"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-04-17 00:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-04-17 15:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-04-17 16:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-04-17 17:33:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-05 01:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck dep updated'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Mohammed Naser with the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-06-27 06:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

has been already implemented with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/729258/14/playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/nova_consoles.yml'}]

commit_message:
Revert "Use non-broken commit for NoVNC"

This reverts commit 33c4f9df3dfc263e5f9084999fade492c30e77fe.

Since change I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b merged in nova,
vnc consoles will work with the latest noVNC.

Closes-Bug: #1822676

Change-Id: I2366e86d03de583ad2e59bfa2313dfe6b7f3701f

commit_message:
Fix the name of the renamed network for trove

The change I60e6126a9fc0ca5c51009fb207642ce2c1afa323 brings the issue with
fail in the translations scenario during the trove configuration. This change
renames the flat network for trove in order to match the required flat name
that is dbaas-mgmt.

Change-Id: I4066d74d3547343929d5208fb453732786b36948
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit fb2925b7a76bf204a93311256224c141f31f3c9e)

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 cinder-grenade jobs

Specialize the grenade-multinode job and test the variations
on upgrade where a few services are available on the subnode only
(c-bak only, c-bak+c-vol, c-bak+c-sch+c-vol).

This backport does not switch to grenade in place of grenade-py3,
as Python 2 is supported on this branch and both version of
the grenade job are needed. It switched from neutron-grenade
to grenade, though.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
(due to some expected changes in the job structure.)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/548936
Change-Id: I3eac1afcbb69e25e9b2a916910caf3291aa7c1fe
(cherry picked from commit 6c1e52cefcf93700fc13c124b45a5fa991261486)
(cherry picked from commit cf5eaae596efbeb4e41500c1dd2825541e1e8252)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 16:44:57.000000000', 'message': "Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

Sometime in 2015, we removed the hard-coded obj_relationships mapping
from parent objects which facilitated semi-automated child version
backports.  This was replaced by a manifest-of-versions mechanism
where the client reports all the supported objects and versions
during a backport request to conductor. The InstancePCIRequests object
isn't technically an ObjectListBase, despite acting like one, and thus
wasn't using the obj_relationships. Because of this, it was doing
its own backporting of its child object, which was not removed in
the culling of the static mechanism. Because we now no longer need to
worry about sub-object backport chaining, when version 1.2 was added,
no backport rule was added, and since the object does not call the
base class' generic routine, proper backporting of the child object
was not happening.

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033
(cherry picked from commit d3ca7356860d64555eef6f5138501cb38f50ecc8)
"}, {'created': '2020-05-06 16:45:48.000000000', 'message': "Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033
(cherry picked from commit d3ca7356860d64555eef6f5138501cb38f50ecc8)
(cherry picked from commit e61d0025303b33ef00aa95ebd934f6121d320cbb)
"}, {'created': '2020-06-26 12:58:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

Sometime in 2015, we removed the hard-coded obj_relationships mapping
from parent objects which facilitated semi-automated child version

where the client reports all the supported objects and versions

isn't technically an ObjectListBase, despite acting like one, and thus
wasn't using the obj_relationships. Because of this, it was doing
its own backporting of its child object, which was not removed in
the culling of the static mechanism. Because we now no longer need to
worry about sub-object backport chaining, when version 1.2 was added,
no backport rule was added, and since the object does not call the
base class' generic routine, proper backporting of the child object
was not happening.

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033
(cherry picked from commit d3ca7356860d64555eef6f5138501cb38f50ecc8)
(cherry picked from commit e61d0025303b33ef00aa95ebd934f6121d320cbb)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

Sometime in 2015, we removed the hard-coded obj_relationships mapping
from parent objects which facilitated semi-automated child version
backports.  This was replaced by a manifest-of-versions mechanism
where the client reports all the supported objects and versions
during a backport request to conductor. The InstancePCIRequests object
isn't technically an ObjectListBase, despite acting like one, and thus
wasn't using the obj_relationships. Because of this, it was doing
its own backporting of its child object, which was not removed in
the culling of the static mechanism. Because we now no longer need to
worry about sub-object backport chaining, when version 1.2 was added,
no backport rule was added, and since the object does not call the
base class' generic routine, proper backporting of the child object
was not happening.

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033
(cherry picked from commit d3ca7356860d64555eef6f5138501cb38f50ecc8)
(cherry picked from commit e61d0025303b33ef00aa95ebd934f6121d320cbb)

[{'created': '2020-05-03 18:10:36.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Fix iSCSI multiattach volume terminates connection

When detaching a volume from an instance, NetApp ONTAP driver terminates
the iSCSI connection, even if there're other connections to the LUN from
the same initiator. This terminates connections to the LUN from other
instances running on the same host.

This patch fixes this bug by leaving the connection untouched if there
are other connections from the same initiator. Now the connection is
terminated only if it's the last one from the same initiator.

Change-Id: I0b8b5930c9e8f3c049b82e92c5fb7b05d6ae9291
Closes-Bug: #1839384
(cherry picked from commit e27d83f4d03a89d982aebbb3fb8a8d1adafbdfc5)
(cherry picked from commit 87b933db778ce5751a75e1dd10ce3a442f9e6902)
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix iSCSI multiattach volume terminates connection

When detaching a volume from an instance, NetApp ONTAP driver terminates
the iSCSI connection, even if there're other connections to the LUN from
the same initiator. This terminates connections to the LUN from other
instances running on the same host.

This patch fixes this bug by leaving the connection untouched if there
are other connections from the same initiator. Now the connection is
terminated only if it's the last one from the same initiator.

Change-Id: I0b8b5930c9e8f3c049b82e92c5fb7b05d6ae9291
Closes-Bug: #1839384
(cherry picked from commit e27d83f4d03a89d982aebbb3fb8a8d1adafbdfc5)
(cherry picked from commit 87b933db778ce5751a75e1dd10ce3a442f9e6902)

[{'created': '2020-06-07 20:51:41.000000000', 'message': "Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
"}, {'created': '2020-06-08 05:10:08.000000000', 'message': "Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910
"}]
commit_message:
Handle subnet without gateway

* When libnetwork requests the IP address of the gateway
  (via /IpamDriver.RequestAddress) and the neutron subnet has gateway
  as None, return '0.0.0.0/0' as a placeholder.
* Disable default docker gateway via the 'DisableGatewayService' flag
  (see https://github.com/moby/libnetwork/pull/778).

Change-Id: I3033d28eb268a01de8cf038b1ed20110ca9a31ea
Closes-Bug: #1881910

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 19:32:35.000000000', 'message': "Enable sparse image conversion

When converting a downloaded image with qemu-img
convert, the full image size is written to the destination
volume.

Add a sparse parameter which defaults to False, which
converts using qemu-img's sparse block detection.  This
allows the output to be written with sparse chunks (here,
set to 1MB).

We may want to add a configuration option for this,
but it seems reasonable as a starting point to let volume
drivers opt into it as appropriate.

The LVM driver uses this method if it is using thin
provisioning.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit 12727dcdfe4484855d8c563396a25462624a16ec)

Change-Id: I12b008458cc49a4b32e86f1a33d262c85fd88e71
"}, {'created': '2019-09-13 18:03:38.000000000', 'message': "Enable sparse image conversion

convert, the full image size is written to the destination
volume.

Add a sparse parameter which defaults to False, which

allows the output to be written with sparse chunks (here,
set to 1MB).

We may want to add a configuration option for this,
but it seems reasonable as a starting point to let volume
drivers opt into it as appropriate.

The LVM driver uses this method if it is using thin
provisioning.

commit_message:
Enable sparse image conversion

When converting a downloaded image with qemu-img
convert, the full image size is written to the destination
volume.

Add a sparse parameter which defaults to False, which
converts using qemu-img's sparse block detection.  This
allows the output to be written with sparse chunks (here,
set to 1MB). Nevertheless, if sparse_size is 0, the source
will not be scanned for unallocated or zero sectors, and the
destination image will always be fully allocated.

We may want to add a configuration option for this,
but it seems reasonable as a starting point to let volume
drivers opt into it as appropriate.

The LVM driver uses this method if it is using thin
provisioning.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I12b008458cc49a4b32e86f1a33d262c85fd88e71

commit_message:
Run openafs promote job only if gate job run

Change https://review.opendev.org/737995 failed the promote job
openafs-rpm-package-build-promote since the gate job was not run.

Add a files sections, so that the promote job is triggered when the gate
job is.

commit_message:
Add deprecated cycle for deprecated deliverables

Adding the deprecated cycle for deliverables marked as
release-management:deprecated for the known deprecated repo.

Few repo are not so clear if those are actually deprecated
or just release-management is deprecated for them, for example:
devstack-plugin-pika, openstack-ansible-os_karbor etc. They are
left as it is until we have proof or confirmation from the project team
about their deprecation.

Change-Id: I3f3bf5cf65a6ce0e5636c2c1c1687956e8da82c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 12:19:00.000000000', 'message': "Guard against missing image cache directory

The original fix of bug 1878024 missed an edge case where on a fresh
hypervisor the image cache directory hasn't been created yet. That
directory is only created when the first image is downloaded.

This patch makes sure that if the cache dir hasn't been created yet then
0 disk is reserved for the cache usage instead of raising and logging an
exception.

Change-Id: Id1bbc955a9099de1abc11b9063fe177896646d03
Related-Bug: #1878024
Closes-Bug: #1884214
(cherry picked from commit a85753778f710f03616a682d294f8f638dea6baf)
"}]
commit_message:
Guard against missing image cache directory

The original fix of bug 1878024 missed an edge case where on a fresh
hypervisor the image cache directory hasn't been created yet. That
directory is only created when the first image is downloaded.

This patch makes sure that if the cache dir hasn't been created yet then
0 disk is reserved for the cache usage instead of raising and logging an
exception.

Change-Id: Id1bbc955a9099de1abc11b9063fe177896646d03
Related-Bug: #1878024
Closes-Bug: #1884214
(cherry picked from commit a85753778f710f03616a682d294f8f638dea6baf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:55:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a

(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)

  grenade jobs, which haven't been backported so far);
- the only change in cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican (removed by this
  change) is the switch to Python 3.

commit_message:
Port several legacy tempest jobs to Zuul v3

- cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend is the simple LVM multibackend job
  and replaces legacy-tempest-dsvm-lvm-multibackend.
- remove legacy-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend, as ZeroMQ
  support was deprecated in Rocky and removed in Stein.
  It could be replaced by inheriting from
  cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend in older branches
  when this patch is backported;
- replace cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican with
  cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican provided by
  cinder-tempest-plugins;
- replace legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs with
  devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full, now provided by
  devstack-plugin-nfs;
- update cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest to also run cinderlib tests.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican/run.yaml
- .zuul.yaml in master contains new jobs (for example, the imported legacy
  grenade jobs, which haven't been backported so far);
- the only change in cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican (removed by this
  change) is the switch to Python 3.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/738078
Change-Id: Icdafaf55494b6dd74ec31c3572d7344fcc028166
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ff0059dc324ea73d0444103fa71c97fb517a)

commit_message:
Enable ZooKeeper when Storm is enabled

ZooKeeper is a dependency of Apache Storm.

[{'created': '2020-04-29 05:36:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert snapshot issue

While there is a related fcmap stays in 100% copying clone state,
and this volume act as target volume in fcmap relationship,
revert snapshot will fail. This fix will stop 100% copying clone
fcmap, then let revert snapshot go.

Closes-bug: #1863070

Change-Id: I6b5f6396ad5524f4086ce5192e32fd5e7fee58a2

commit_message:
Fix revert snapshot issue

While there is a related fcmap stays in 100% copying clone state,
and this volume act as target volume in fcmap relationship,
revert snapshot will fail. This fix will stop 100% copying clone
fcmap, then let revert snapshot go.

Closes-bug: #1863070

Change-Id: I6b5f6396ad5524f4086ce5192e32fd5e7fee58a2
(cherry picked from commit 9b4321f8462b32206c8d684442606b57a6af20da)

commit_message:
Drop monitoring of nova-compute process

This is pretty problematic check as after each minor upgrade
it cause cycle nova-compute restart (and all hypervisors being down)
until masakari-processmonitor upgrade and restart.

Change-Id: Iacf5086ce6443b3504d582cd8c7a82dd1d4c7fb5
(cherry picked from commit 6fc66ab68caaae9b429378b668638092d2f04ead)

subject: Make octavia service_auth project configurable
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-25 11:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/train.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 11:02:11.000000000', 'message': "Make octavia service_auth project configurable

(Renamed and adapted from Switch octavia to use service project in
 service_auth on master and stable/ussuri)

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch to Train and
earlier branches it should be switched to 'admin' to maintain
compatibility.

In Train and earlier, if a deployer keeps the default
'octavia_service_auth_project' of 'admin', the octavia user will be
assigned the admin role in the admin project, as was done previously.
They may also set 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'service' to use the
new behaviour, and avoid a breaking change when later upgrading to
Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)
(cherry picked from commit 1851d881261bc07f0f40179e427fd5f0e9c5a0ab)
"}, {'created': '2020-06-26 19:11:26.000000000', 'message': "Make octavia service_auth project configurable

(Renamed and adapted from Switch octavia to use service project in
 service_auth on master and stable/ussuri)

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch to Train and
earlier branches it should be switched to 'admin' to maintain
compatibility.

In Train and earlier, if a deployer keeps the default
'octavia_service_auth_project' of 'admin', the octavia user will be
assigned the admin role in the admin project, as was done previously.
They may also set 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'service' to use the
new behaviour, and avoid a breaking change when later upgrading to
Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)
(cherry picked from commit 1851d881261bc07f0f40179e427fd5f0e9c5a0ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Make octavia service_auth project configurable

(Renamed and adapted from Switch octavia to use service project in
 service_auth on master and stable/ussuri)

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch to Train and
earlier branches it should be switched to 'admin' to maintain
compatibility.

In Train and earlier, if a deployer keeps the default
'octavia_service_auth_project' of 'admin', the octavia user will be
assigned the admin role in the admin project, as was done previously.
They may also set 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'service' to use the
new behaviour, and avoid a breaking change when later upgrading to
Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)
(cherry picked from commit 1851d881261bc07f0f40179e427fd5f0e9c5a0ab)

When a Port is deleted, the QoS extension will reset any rule (QoS
and Queue registers) applied on this port or will reset the

commit_message:
[OVS] Make QoS OVS agent deletion operations more resilient

When a Port is deleted, the QoS extension will reset any rule (QoS
and Queue registers) applied on this port or will reset the
related Interface policing parameters.

If the Port and the related Interface are deleted during the QoS
extension operation, those commands will fail. This patch makes those
operations more resiliant by not checking the errors when writing on
the Port or the Interface register.

Change-Id: I2cc4cdf5be25fab6adbc64acabb3fffebb693fa6
Closes-Bug: #1884512
(cherry picked from commit e2d1c2869a2c8883157d29cf47d7a5236e63dbc1)
(cherry picked from commit 84ac8cf9ffb66d826d9d7875bb0d1addc9120034)
(cherry picked from commit 3785868bfb387002f4a89d3fa18c20210e8f17db)

commit_message:
Fix error on devstack cleanup

Change I7ebf4137feb04827490dffc0dac3d6e4c8888075 added 'set -e' in
devstack/plugin.sh, but on devstack cleanup, some commands may fail
because of non-working services (i.e after a reboot).
This commit allows 'openstack keypair delete' to fail on clean up.

Change-Id: Ic782faba3eb907d29b6735ac0a6d6a8a2e104e00

commit_message:
Run all noop operations in molecule testing.

This change allows molecule to also render the scripts
created by tripleo-upgrade role.

Besides the changes in the molecule tests, which imply
including some mock files (overcloud_deploy.sh, stackrc and
tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml) so tripleo-upgrade could work
it also adapts some of the tasks to not run any OpenStack
CLI command when update_noop, ffu_noop or upgrade_noop options
are set to true. The reason why, is because these three
options are intended to run only the scripts generation tasks
so there is no need to have a functional TripleO system running
against.

Change-Id: I4c42b6f9d77d1c20d9c241bcd3d57292350ffe84
(cherry picked from commit 197437ed5d5d8b789b821ad50a2bc97c37819dfb)

commit_message:
Run all noop operations in molecule testing.

This change allows molecule to also render the scripts
created by tripleo-upgrade role.

Besides the changes in the molecule tests, which imply
including some mock files (overcloud_deploy.sh, stackrc and
tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml) so tripleo-upgrade could work
it also adapts some of the tasks to not run any OpenStack
CLI command when update_noop, ffu_noop or upgrade_noop options
are set to true. The reason why, is because these three
options are intended to run only the scripts generation tasks
so there is no need to have a functional TripleO system running
against.

Change-Id: I4c42b6f9d77d1c20d9c241bcd3d57292350ffe84
(cherry picked from commit 197437ed5d5d8b789b821ad50a2bc97c37819dfb)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 17119, 'name': 'Dmitrii Kabanov', 'email': 'dmitrii.kabanov@att.com', 'username': 'dk370c'}, {'_account_id': 18511, 'name': 'Brian Wickersham', 'email': 'bkw86@bellsouth.net', 'username': 'bw6938'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28372, 'name': 'chinasubbareddy mallavarapu', 'email': 'cr3938@att.com', 'username': 'chinasubbareddy'}, {'_account_id': 29131, 'name': 'diwakar thyagaraj', 'email': 'diwakar.chitoor.thyagaraj@att.com', 'username': 'dt241s@att.com'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-25 21:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-06-26 05:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-26 14:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2020-06-26 15:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-26 15:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-26 16:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-06-26 16:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-06-26 16:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29131, 'date': '2020-06-26 17:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2020-06-26 17:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17119, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 21:45:28.000000000', 'message': "[ceph-osd] Liveness probe success in preboot state with noup flag

OSDs fail the liveness probe if they can't make it to the 'active'
state. The noup flag keeps OSDs in the 'preboot' state, which
prevents the liveness probe from succeeding. This change adds an
additional check in the liveness probe to allow it to succeed if

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Liveness probe success in preboot state with noup flag

OSDs fail the liveness probe if they can't make it to the 'active'
state. The noup flag keeps OSDs in the 'preboot' state, which
prevents the liveness probe from succeeding. This change adds an
additional check in the liveness probe to allow it to succeed if
the noup flag is set and OSDs are in the 'preboot' state.

Change-Id: I8df5954f7bc4ef4374e19344b6e0a9130764d60c

"}, {'created': '2020-06-23 10:32:00.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Make sure UpgradeLevelNovaCompute is empty string for upgrade

This value causes issues with livemigration that will be
addressed later in puppet-nova with proper fix. (#1871482).

This patch assigns the empty string value to the parameter
to make sure it doesn't have any other value assigned before
performing an upgrade.

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Resolves-Bug: #1849235

Change-Id: If5f8c3391efa9d283bcbbde388f6e1b8143f2db5
"}, {'created': '2020-06-26 11:13:52.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Make sure UpgradeLevelNovaCompute is empty string for upgrade

This value causes issues with live migration that will be
addressed later (see related launchpad bug).
    
This patch assigns the empty string value to the parameter
to make sure it doesn't have any other value assigned before
performing an upgrade.
    
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1849235
Related-Bug: rhbz#1851239
Related-Bug: #1871482

Change-Id: If5f8c3391efa9d283bcbbde388f6e1b8143f2db5
"}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Make sure UpgradeLevelNovaCompute is empty string for upgrade

This value causes issues with live migration that will be
addressed later (see related launchpad bug).
    
This patch assigns the empty string value to the parameter
to make sure it doesn't have any other value assigned before
performing an upgrade.
    
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1849235
Related-Bug: rhbz#1851239
Related-Bug: #1871482

Change-Id: If5f8c3391efa9d283bcbbde388f6e1b8143f2db5

commit_message:
Change neutron-ovs-agent deploy only with manila generic backend

Change openvswitch & neutron-openvswitch-agent to deploy only
with manila generic backend - which uses ovs-vsctl functionality
when configuring share servers.

Change-Id: I124108cda62b38ea498612ff9ddb07d6122a330c
Closes-Bug: #1884939

commit_message:
Change neutron-ovs-agent deploy only with manila generic backend

Change openvswitch & neutron-openvswitch-agent to deploy only
with manila generic backend - which uses ovs-vsctl functionality
when configuring share servers.

Change-Id: I124108cda62b38ea498612ff9ddb07d6122a330c
Closes-Bug: #1884939

commit_message:
hardware: Remove handling of pre-Train compute nodes

Now that we're into Ussuri, we no longer need to worry about receiving
objects from pre-Train compute nodes. Remove the code that was handling
this along with a couple of other TODOs that have either been resolved
or will never be resolved.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: I771117f18bfab7d73de8e431168c964a96d419e8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

Also pin designate-tempest-plugin to the latest tag that still supports
python2.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: I8eb1a244ac9d79c9915c222af5afd298bdb04997

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 17:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173

This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"

This patch corrects this problem by including those filter

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9

commit_message:
Fix neutron subnet lookup ignoring endpoint_type

The recent patch[1] that adds a neutron subnet lookup using the user
context is not honoring the interface/endpoint_type or region_name
settings for neutron in the octavia configuration file.
This is causing problems for deployments that use the "internal"
endpoint for neutron and the current code will always return
the "public" endpoint.
This patch corrects this problem by including those filter
parameters when the neutron endpoint is looked up in keystone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726042

Change-Id: I7b8f7c7d653b37395f9a660be67f954a3a6f26d9
Story: 2007863
Task: 40173

commit_message:
Fix batch member create for v1 amphora driver

A previous patch[1] missed batch_member_update when adding database
repository "get" method retries for new object creation actions.
This patch fixes batch member create to retry the database get call
when new members are being created via batch member update.
This issue only impacts the v1 amphora driver as the v2 driver
does not need to get these objects from the database.

Story: 2007581
Task: 39503

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/commit/48e85569f7e43e3dd5f09fd1ef4cb165526a92cd

Change-Id: Ia3476ab7b24dc3fd6e29ff2abe6eb6bacd9908ed

I don't think this will ever work in the "clean" phase of devstack. I think nova is already down by then. This is why I moved it up to the "unstack" phase.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2020-06-25 08:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Well, it's good that we have the -e check.

 > I think nova is already down by then. This is why I moved it up to
 > the "unstack" phase.

The issue I have is that "keypair delete" is failing after a reboot (basically after a reboot, I run: ./unstack.sh; ./clean.sh), moving keypair deletion in the unstack phase doesn't fix it.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 23:13:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix devstack cleanup keypair delete

The devstack plugin had an issue where it was attempting to delete
the nova SSH keypair after nova was already not available.
This patch moves the keypair deletion from the cleanup phase to the
stop (unstack) phase to make sure nova is still available to complete
the action.

Change-Id: Ic7b7c3957a80796f99299473486cded19f15ceb9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack cleanup keypair delete

The devstack plugin had an issue where it was attempting to delete
the nova SSH keypair after nova was already not available.
This patch moves the keypair deletion from the cleanup phase to the
stop (unstack) phase to make sure nova is still available to complete
the action.

Change-Id: Ic7b7c3957a80796f99299473486cded19f15ceb9

[{'created': '2020-06-25 13:37:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix netcat option in udp_check.sh for CentOS/RHEL

-w (timeout) option doesn't do anything in nmap-ncat (default netcat in
CentOS/RHEL) for UDP datagrams, and nmap-ncat has a default idle timeout
set to 2 seconds.
We can get the same behavior as netcap-openbsd (Debian/Ubuntu) by
setting that idle timeout (-i) option to 1 second.

This commit detects the flavor of the netcat binary (nmap vs other) and
uses it to adapt the parameters.

Story: 2007688
Task: 39800

Change-Id: I0100aaa428477f011bd39a90dd4ec98199b4bebc
(cherry picked from commit 6354f92ecc529c3f813733c8437768a432975dbc)
(cherry picked from commit 209726d9197aebd57acefe29c263aa68bdd811ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix netcat option in udp_check.sh for CentOS/RHEL

-w (timeout) option doesn't do anything in nmap-ncat (default netcat in
CentOS/RHEL) for UDP datagrams, and nmap-ncat has a default idle timeout
set to 2 seconds.
We can get the same behavior as netcap-openbsd (Debian/Ubuntu) by
setting that idle timeout (-i) option to 1 second.

This commit detects the flavor of the netcat binary (nmap vs other) and
uses it to adapt the parameters.

Story: 2007688
Task: 39800

Change-Id: I0100aaa428477f011bd39a90dd4ec98199b4bebc
(cherry picked from commit 6354f92ecc529c3f813733c8437768a432975dbc)
(cherry picked from commit 209726d9197aebd57acefe29c263aa68bdd811ba)

commit_message:
Retrieve KuryrNets CR when supported

Right now we're attempt to get a KuryrNetworks CR after namespace
creation regardless if it's supported or not on the Cluster, which
causes the test test_ipblock_network_policy_allow_except to fail with
NotFound.

This commit fixes the issue by ensuring the correct CR is retrieved
when supported.

Change-Id: Ifce4316cf58ae010b267fd99b654cd816c0bff8a

commit_message:
Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file

Before this change, the values were set to haproxy defaults,
however, these should not be used. The keystone endpoint
should be verified by the system's default CA certificates,
which are mounted into the neutron_api container.

Change-Id: I35b39a1bc0e1793116831485180a49da5e0a019a
Closes-Bug: #1883741
Resolves: rhbz#1844592
(cherry picked from commit 9befc582571757cfd2bfd45f491617af3d563af8)

commit_message:
Allow override of mysql/galera open files limit

This commit removes the hard coded value of open-file-limit (16384)
and allows operators to override it via:

tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql::open_files_limit
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::open_files_limit

depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738157

[{'created': '2020-06-23 12:36:25.000000000', 'message': "Change the :Z mount flag to :z

Leaving this with the capital Z limits access to this file
to the other novajoin container. This can cause the other
container to malfunction. At the very best, the other
container will restart, relabeling the file with it's
settings, which has the proper value of lower z.

Change-Id: Iebcfb9509c58619f9d68d3036775f07683a0fa42
(cherry picked from commit a6fa6027275bd650390cd538abffd7f06da24756)
"}]
commit_message:
Change the :Z mount flag to :z

Leaving this with the capital Z limits access to this file
to the other novajoin container. This can cause the other
container to malfunction. At the very best, the other
container will restart, relabeling the file with it's
settings, which has the proper value of lower z.

Change-Id: Iebcfb9509c58619f9d68d3036775f07683a0fa42
(cherry picked from commit a6fa6027275bd650390cd538abffd7f06da24756)

commit_message:
collectd: add support for mcelog service

Adding a new parameter, CollectdEnableMcelog (False by default) is set
to True, a new host prep task will include the new
"tripleo_provision_mcelog" role to configure the mcelog service on the
host where the collectd container is running.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/730409

Change-Id: Ia2280092abb0d769a92994ad337ed2b583f54175
(cherry picked from commit a0cbe767235ec18c88642ad29a2dcdc51b10c966)

A first patch is a very good time to take good commit messages habits.

Can you explain why this fixes offline installation?'}, {'account_id': 31763, 'date': '2020-06-12 15:34:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > A first patch is a very good time to take good commit messages
 > habits.
 > 
 > Can you explain why this fixes offline installation?

Hi! sure, I'll rework the commit message, I don't know why but it didn't honored my line breaks.

Regarding the why, it's all explained within the bug report, but all in all, it's fixing issue for people that perform offline installation because if the block is upper, the install package use a repository that's targeting an internet mirror. If the block is bellow, then offline installation will have override the default repositories by their own and so it's now working.

In case you don't override the default repositories and you're not allowing an internet access of course it doesn't work neither.

The goal here is to get ride of a custom empty block within the template-override.j2 and then a reassign later once the repos have been overriden."}, {'account_id': 31763, 'date': '2020-06-12 15:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8564f13bbb2d31e9b05b7a2393a4ef1844cc55a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 07:51:45.000000000', 'message': "Make _ensure_default_security_group method atomic

Method _ensure_default_security_group wasn't atomic as it first tries to get
default SG and if that not exists in DB, it tries to create it.

It may happend, like e.g. in Calico plugin that between
get_default_sg_id method and create_security_group method, this default
SG will be created by other neutron worker. And in such case there will
be Duplicate entry exception raised.

So this patch is adding handling of such exception.

Change-Id: I515c310f221e7d9ae3be59a26260538d1bc591c2
Closes-Bug: #1883730
(cherry picked from commit 7019c5cf50bc4ad97b302220664a26efaf81a7fd)
"}]
commit_message:
Make _ensure_default_security_group method atomic

Method _ensure_default_security_group wasn't atomic as it first tries to get
default SG and if that not exists in DB, it tries to create it.

It may happend, like e.g. in Calico plugin that between
get_default_sg_id method and create_security_group method, this default
SG will be created by other neutron worker. And in such case there will
be Duplicate entry exception raised.

So this patch is adding handling of such exception.

Change-Id: I515c310f221e7d9ae3be59a26260538d1bc591c2
Closes-Bug: #1883730
(cherry picked from commit 7019c5cf50bc4ad97b302220664a26efaf81a7fd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 07:51:29.000000000', 'message': "Make _ensure_default_security_group method atomic

Method _ensure_default_security_group wasn't atomic as it first tries to get
default SG and if that not exists in DB, it tries to create it.

It may happend, like e.g. in Calico plugin that between
get_default_sg_id method and create_security_group method, this default
SG will be created by other neutron worker. And in such case there will
be Duplicate entry exception raised.

So this patch is adding handling of such exception.

Change-Id: I515c310f221e7d9ae3be59a26260538d1bc591c2
Closes-Bug: #1883730
(cherry picked from commit 7019c5cf50bc4ad97b302220664a26efaf81a7fd)
"}]
commit_message:
Make _ensure_default_security_group method atomic

Method _ensure_default_security_group wasn't atomic as it first tries to get
default SG and if that not exists in DB, it tries to create it.

It may happend, like e.g. in Calico plugin that between
get_default_sg_id method and create_security_group method, this default
SG will be created by other neutron worker. And in such case there will
be Duplicate entry exception raised.

So this patch is adding handling of such exception.

Change-Id: I515c310f221e7d9ae3be59a26260538d1bc591c2
Closes-Bug: #1883730
(cherry picked from commit 7019c5cf50bc4ad97b302220664a26efaf81a7fd)

commit_message:
Nova raise exceptions when extending volume fails

When extending volume failed in nova with exception of volume not found
or connection_info is None, nova will not raise exception, in that case,
we execute nova instnce-action-list will not return ERROR, we mistakenly
thought that the volume extending was successful , this patch'll fix it，
when extending volume in-use failed, we can find out via executing nova
instance-action-list

Change-Id: I24359de100fc7b9695e8bdb1076886fc35da4d6e
Closes-Bug: #1843008

commit_message:
Remove pre-gate cleanup tasks for the new plain CI images

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/015157.html

Also set openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_metal-opensuse-15 as opensuse metal
job is not working and breaking all roles on the stable/train branch

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/736512
Change-Id: Ifeec7031ca117f5e38e9aa6af4228409ffe7d4f1
(cherry picked from commit a3f828954b0ce3fd73c8564027523f4434614a70)

[{'created': '2020-06-24 14:13:03.000000000', 'message': "Wait for systemd-tmpfiles-setup service to complete after container restart

There is a race condition between starting an lxc container and executing
the first ansible task. Ansible makes heavy use of /tmp and the first
task executed after 'lxc-start' will collide with systemd-tmpfiles-setup
which by default removes all content from /tmp, including the working
files of any ansible task which happens to be running. This causes a fatal
error for ansible which cannot be recovered with retries.

This patch adds a raw command to check the state of the tmpfiles-setup
service and wait until it has completed, avoiding the race confdition.

Change-Id: I4ada8473bfd17b763bde16ac95099ddf7deb541c
(cherry picked from commit 8e9bdba3226bc69250da9d59825e4950f2f211eb)
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for systemd-tmpfiles-setup service to complete after container restart

There is a race condition between starting an lxc container and executing
the first ansible task. Ansible makes heavy use of /tmp and the first
task executed after 'lxc-start' will collide with systemd-tmpfiles-setup
which by default removes all content from /tmp, including the working
files of any ansible task which happens to be running. This causes a fatal
error for ansible which cannot be recovered with retries.

This patch adds a raw command to check the state of the tmpfiles-setup
service and wait until it has completed, avoiding the race confdition.

Change-Id: I4ada8473bfd17b763bde16ac95099ddf7deb541c
(cherry picked from commit 8e9bdba3226bc69250da9d59825e4950f2f211eb)

commit_message:
Fix developer compute-kit.sh script

Release overrides are not applied in component script if invoked from
developer ceph one because OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_NOVA is not empty.

Change-Id: Ic4eb1cf6115b740b59922272a789e37b683cb44e
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 16:16:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove pycodestyle from the dependency

This patch fixes environments where tox is not used for flake8 runs. It
does the following:

 - removes pycodestyle dependency because flake8 itself has already a
   dependency on pycodestyle

 - currently capped pycodestyle is not compatible with the used flake8
   there is an error when installing pycodestyle 2.5.0 with the used
   flake8 3.8.3

 - because pycodestyle 2.6.0 is installed as a flake8 dependency, a new
   check E741 is introduced. Such a rule required to change 'l'
   variables to 'listeners'

 - pycodestyle 2.6.0 also runs flake8 on tests directory. To avoid doing
   so, tests directory is added to the exclude list explicitely.

NOTE: This is going to stable/train only because Ussuri and master
      switche to hacking 3.0.1 that fixes above issues.

Change-Id: Ib8d7c9d3ad7f7c44e858b7796e0e83f39a4e3d9e
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove pycodestyle from the dependency

This patch fixes environments where tox is not used for flake8 runs. It
does the following:

 - removes pycodestyle dependency because flake8 itself has already a
   dependency on pycodestyle

 - currently capped pycodestyle is not compatible with the used flake8
   there is an error when installing pycodestyle 2.5.0 with the used
   flake8 3.8.3

 - because pycodestyle 2.6.0 is installed as a flake8 dependency, a new
   check E741 is introduced. Such a rule required to change 'l'
   variables to 'listeners'

 - pycodestyle 2.6.0 also runs flake8 on tests directory. To avoid doing
   so, tests directory is added to the exclude list explicitely.

NOTE: This is going to stable/train only because Ussuri and master
      switche to hacking 3.0.1 that fixes above issues.

Change-Id: Ib8d7c9d3ad7f7c44e858b7796e0e83f39a4e3d9e
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
